Reviews.Title: “simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: Werner_inSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a definite recommendation if you want to experience Venice. I thought I was living in a movie and found it difficult to leave. From french champagne breakfast to high tea we had a ball. The staff is very friendly and assist in every manner. Thank you for the memories.

Reviews.Title: “High standards in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: Oldcolonial
Reviews.Content: Having scoured the internet for a long time trying to choose a hotel in Venice and doing as much research as possible to avoid being disappointed I am pleased to say upon arrival the Ca Sagredo lived up to expectations. My wife and I recently had the pleasure of staying here for 5 nights and were delighted with both the hotel and location as nothing is that far away and the vaporetto stop is virtually outside the hotel. We received a warm welcome from the reception team and had a lovely room 406 on the 4th floor with views over the rooftops of Venice, the room was of a very good size and well furnished, it was also extremely clean and everything was well maintained. The breakfast was very good and the staff were excellent and could not do enough for you, a glass or two of prosecco before heading out in the morning was a great way to start the day, the reception team were also very helpful recommending things to do, places to see and restaurants and taking the time to mark everything on the essential maps as it is very easy to get lost in Venice. There is absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel and we would stay again, I would recommend it to anyone that enjoys luxury, refined and elegant service and some of the most helpful and friendly staff you will ever meet. I also recommend taking the speedboat from the airport directly to the hotel, it really is the only way to arrive and worth the cost. Hope to be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just go - Venice is a must!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker186543
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, there is absolutely nothing negative to say about Venice or Ca'Sagredo Hotel. Both are outstanding. We shall most definitely return. Venice is maybe a bit tired around the edges but she is beautiful and so are the people there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, original Venice residence”
Reviews.Author: Hamu_ham
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a former palace of rich family, it is well maintained and keep all the original decorations. Although it feel a little gloomy (old foors, cupboard, chandelier), the hotel really reflects the real Venice palace in 16-17centuries.The rooms are spacious(by venice standard) and free Wifi. The hotel is convenient located on Grad canal. The vaporetto stop is next to the hotel (Ca d'Oro), the cross-canal gondola is in front of the hotel (0.5 euro fee), and water taxi can park directly at the hotel entrance. At the back of the hotel we can find McDonald's, supermarket within 2mins walk. And we can walk 5-7 mins to Riato bridge. The only comment is breakfast choice is not so extensive, mainly continental style with pastries, yogurt, fruits, and juices. It would be perfect if you could add more hot dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place in the beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sard-eller
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days in Ca' Sagredo. The normal double room was unbelievably luxurious. Big, beautifully decorated and with a fantastic bathroom. TV in the bathroom should become a must for 5***** hotels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Brett C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights on our honeymoon last April and it was unbelievable. I booked well out in advance and got a great deal on a junior suite through expedia and emailed them to explain it was my honeymoon and they bent over backwards to make sure our stay there was memorable. They upgraded our room to a stunning, just massive suite, that felt like staying in a museum. We were supposed to stay in the suite for two nights and then move to a less expensive room the third, but when we asked about it they just said it was easier for everyone if we stayed in the historic suite - we didn't argue.They also provided a small bottle of Prosecco and a few chocolates upon check that included a note from the manager congratulating us and wishing us a pleasant stay. Top to bottom a fantastic place that handled everything well from a water taxi to the airport to making our Honeymoon just that much more special. That said, it's a luxury hotel so things like breakfast and other extraneous services aren't bargains, but just staying in a beautiful/historic place like this makes it all worth while. Bathroom was beautiful and well equipped, the bed was pretty comfortable - but the furnishing and general ambiance of the hotel was out of this world. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular palace with incredible suites and warm service”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone4ever
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel to celebrate my 40th birthday. Unfortunately my partner is unwell so there was a change of plan and I took a friend instead. It wasn't the romantic trip planned but was still fabulous and truly memorable. Our historic suite (204) was gigantic and exquisite. The service was friendly and efficient. The location of the hotel is perfect. The restaurant - food and service - was first class. This is a very special place. (if you go, check out La Cantina just down the road. Brilliant - don't be put off by the lack of menu or price list. Just go with flow.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KJBKKKHK
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel for many reasons. The building itself is right on the canal. With great room views. It is very historic hotel with neat stairways and lighting. Our room was very beautiful and bed was comfy- we would know...we got food poisoning (from another place) and had to spend almost our entire vaca in the room. The staff helped us so much by bringing gatorade and chicken soup up to us. They also offer to send a MD up but I am a nurse so we decided not to have the consult. The hotel lounge was a bit pricey but had amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “5 star plus plus”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: Wow how fabulous , we were upgraded to the most fantastic suite with complimentary prosseco and chocolates Dinner to die for !! overlooking the grand canal Attentive waiters served all our meals I am a hotelier and have travelled to 5 star hotels throughout the world This is the most beautiful place ever ! location perfect , staff were so very professional and friendly ,spotless rooms and the building really is a stunning palace we were celebrating our anniversary and really wish we had honeymooned here The breakfast was excellent with classical music playing Location is right next to the ca ' doro vaporetta stop to use the public water bus the tragetto Close to the Rialto Bridge but just away from the hustle and bustle We will be back very soon Thankyou very very much.

Reviews.Title: “great place and great location”
Reviews.Author: velmciti
Reviews.Content: we booked 2 months in advance and got a great rate. the hotel is next to rialto and ca doro, so arriving and leaving by ship is no problem. staff is friendly, rooms are large, bathrooms are new and large. breakfast is for italian standards sensationell, stafff is friendly. so all in all for that price, that location, a star hotel in venice is really a great pick.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend at Ca'Sagredo”
Reviews.Author: t1curt
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Ca'Sagredo Hotel on the first weekend in March for 3 Nights after arriving via water taxi we found the staff very friendly and helpful at check in. We were staying in a Junior Suite which was well worth the little extra for the space and comfort it provided, large bathroom, sitting area and bedroom and complimentry Prosecco and Chocolates on arrival. Breakfast was in a Grand Room on the 3rd floor which was beautiful and the food was a nice variety and the staff were friendly and accomodating. We never eat lunch or dinner at the hotel as we were always out exploring Venice but when we returned in the evening we had cocktails in the bar and these were of excellent quality and the Bar Man was very friendly. This hotel is also in a great lcoation for exploring and has lovely views of the Grand Canal. I would recommend this hotel as it is very peaceful when inside but it is right next to the hussle of Venice when you are outside.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal hotel for Venice”
Reviews.Author: dfall
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on the Grand Canal close to Ca d'Oro water bus stop which is only a few stops from the main Bus Station and Railway Station. It also backs onto the Strada Nova shopping street. The hotel has beautiful decor. Reception staff speak english and are very helpful. Breakfast is very acceptable again with helpful staff and you can have Prosecco with breakfast if you wish. It is also possible to have drinks or a meal on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and whilst prices are not cheap they do reflect the 5 star hotel rating and location. Our twin bedded room was excellent with a large modern marble faced bathroom and the TV provided programmes in many languages including english. There was free wifi but server speeds were slow. It is certainly a hotel to seriously consider and we will use it again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: In 2008 My Wife & I had our wedding reception at Ca Sagredo, which was the best experience of our lives. Everything was perfect on our wedding day - The building, the staff, the service, everything! Roll on to Feb 2012 and we have returned to Ca Sagredo for the first time since our wedding. We were greeted warmly by reception who welcomed us back, and kindly upgraded us to a room with a view of the grand canal - instantly putting a huge smile on our faces. The room itself was amazing, words can barely describe the feeling of waking up and opening the curtains to see the site of the grand canal & bell tower out of the window - it was absolutely incredible. We had food in the alcova restaurant on our first evening and the food & service was impeccable. We weren't feeling overly hungry so we skipped a starter and went for mains only - despite this, we were sent some complimentary appetisers from the chef...again, a huge smile was created! The food was exceptional. The service was great. The whole atmosphere of the restaurant is wonderful - Its very small, so it feels very intimate and it allows the waiting staff to really do a great job of looking after the guests. Obviously after our wedding day Ca Sagredo holds a special place in our hearts, but it is warming to know that 4 years on we were treated equally as special.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing palazzo in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Carnaval, in February 2012. It was one of the memorible and perfect places we ever stayed, which provide all the necessary backgrounds for being in this anmazing city) The palace of the hotel is just a masterpiece, built in 15 centuty and carefully preserved by its owners. Some halls of the hotels really could be museums with its amazing sculptures, mosaics and painting ceiling. We had stumning big room, overlooking the Grand Canal, consist of amazing bedroom with antique furniture and small cabinet with a balcony. Breakfast was really good, the stuff was friendly, so we`ve received the attitude and emotions we were expected.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay. Thank you so much.”
Reviews.Author: TuRoLondon
Reviews.Content: We are just back from another fantastic stay at the Ca' Sagredo. Thank you to all the staff who made this such a special experience. The hotel is magical, very service minded, friendlly and clean. Superb huge beds and verybeautifully decorated. "Great breakfast as well. We have stayed in other five star hotels, but this one really deserves its rating !! We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a 5 star hotel - a great disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Arabella1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer in a smallish, heavily furnished, room with a view of the Grand Canal. The smallish high windows were heavily curtained with shutters that partly obscured the light so the room was gloomy and you had to stand on tiptoe to get much of a view. This was a special trip for a special birthday and the hotel had been recommended by a friend influential in the travel trade so we had high expectations. Enough said. This hotel disappointed from start to finish. Our arrival was dealt with curtly. The front desk was generally poor, apart from one excellent girl,.There were odd incidents of porters/management being not just ineffectual but comically ill-mannered - more Fawlty Towers than 5 star! Food took hours in the dining room and then the order was wrong. Waiters, though pleasant, served across you. Breakfast was inadequate - juice not freshly squeezed and eggs, eg omelettes, only cooked freshly for you if you paid a large supplement. The 'music room' next door had piped musak. What about Vivaldi or other classical Venetian composers? The manager, who was unavailable throughout our stay, despite our requests, failed to address our concerns even afterwards yet thought she had done so. There were many niggles. Bathroom was small with poor ventilation - the mirror was frequently steamed up.. Airconditioning control was inadequate as apparently centrally controlled. We asked for a blanket as we were cold but were asleep by the time it arrived. Storage and wardrobe space were totally inadequate - ok for one briefly perhaps, but for two for a few days?? I could go on ad infinitum. This was a disappointing stay made bearable only because we had our own access to a private club on the Grand Canal where a genuine welcome and warm, civilised service was available in abundance. The contrast could not have been greater.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: natalyaca
Reviews.Content: Traveling for 2 weeks between Rome , Florence and Venice. Venice was my favorite stop in Italy! What a great choice, Ca'Sagredo hotel! We stayed in Jr suite. Room was very large! Even so we did not had a view of the canal, I love everything about our room! Great breakfast too! Would love yo stay there again if I ever get back to Venice :)

Reviews.Title: “A real living palace - and with excellent service from attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: irw69
Reviews.Content: I wanted to book something special for my wife's 40th birthday and had high expectations of our trip. This normally leads to disappointment - but not in this case. The hotel, staff and our room led to a really fantastic weekend. Much is made on trip advisor of the hotel being an ancient monument and it is - but you were made to feel at home in its amazing public rooms, where magazines, newspapers and complimentary drinks made it clear that you were welcome to stay and enjoy the rooms. On arrival, reception was more efficient than welcoming, but we were seen to our room by a very friendly, jovial porter. Our room was on the third floor and was a comfortable size (rooms on the 1st and 2nd floor were bigger) but we were more than happy with ours - and with a great (side) view of the Rialoto market and Grand Canal. The room was immaculately clean and very comfortable (including the bed's mattress - even though our double was made up of two singles). The room was a little warm and we couldn't work out how to use the heating / air conditioning - but given this was winter, it didn't matter. Also, can't believe that others have complained about no English TV - BBC world news, CNN and Sky News are all freely available ... and if you really want to watch English TV rather than enjoy Venice you must be mad! Breakfast was excellent - with a wide range of options included (including standard English, continental) and being Italy, you even had Proseco freely available to go with your meal. The staff were extremely attentive and helpful - but remained unobtrusive. We seem to spend an age enjoying our breakfasts with numerous fresh pots of tea and coffee being offered. Could not fault the service, the quality of the food or the lovely room in which it is served in the slightest. Having found found some fantastic little restaurants not too far from the hotel, reception made the reservations for us. Each evening we had a drink in the hotel bar, where they weren't cheap, but it was a great way to start the evening (again with very attentive, helpful, unobtrusive staff) - and a lovely range of canapes were provided and replenished. So in summary - a fantastic real palace to enjoy, with excellent service provided by friendly, helpful and attentive staff. Wouldn't dream of going anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: padser
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. It's in a great location and we got a lovely room for our two nights. We went elsewhere for eating and drinking out so can't comment on the food. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - Venice is always beautiful even in winter!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchParis
Reviews.Content: After a rather bumpy flight over the Alps, we landed in Venice aiport, picked up a water taxi and 20 minutes later arrived at Ca Sagrado hotel. This was our first stay and a very nice experience. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the historical suites, the Stucco suite, and spent 4 lovely days there. Breakfast offer was very good, and we also had lunch at the Alcova restaurant. Staying in such a historical place was magic. Location was very good too, close to major sights in Venice. We enjoyed an excellent service throughout our stay with dedicated staff, so we can only recommend this hotel for those who wish to splurge while in Venice. Reception staff was extremely helpful upon departure when we realized that one of our suitcases was broken: scissors and reinforced scotch tape helped us to solve the matter until we were back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but!!!”
Reviews.Author: leighsha
Reviews.Content: Just come back from the sagredo after reading all the wonderful reviews we just had to go it is true it is a beautiful hotel, but it lacks ambiance and is so quiet especially at breakfast you dare'nt speak to loud the price of everything in the hotel was extortionate 7 euro ,s for a coke,10 euro for a boiled egg,15 euros for a bowl of soup and the breakfast was not all that sausages were as small as my little finger and the bread was a very small triangle and be quick as by time i got up to get an orange juice the whole lot was cold well it was served on a cold plate to begin with !!! our room was really hot too as the air conditioning didn't work, we stayed for Christmas but decided not to eat at the hotel that evening as the breakfast left allot to be desired then we didnt want to chance paying 80 euro s per head for it to realise it wasn't nice, so all in all beautiful hotel great location but very expensive and like a quiet library .inside .ps forgot to mention its 25 euro,s a day to watch english telly enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: sisinbc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Ca Sagredo by water taxi. In the interior, we found a combination of a museum and an art gallery; gorgeous murals, paintings, architecture, and staff who obviously are proud of their surroundings. As we were early, so we enjoyed a glass of wine on the terrace - reasonable prices and great location. To the left was a gondola station; to the right was a vaporetti stop; across the river was the market; and everywhere we looked was a panoramic photograph waiting to happen. When our room was ready, we were taken to Room 204, the Sala di Sebastiano Ricci (now called the Historical Grand Suite). The whole ceiling was a stuccoed masterpiece; antique furniture/fabrics/decor and Murano glass replicated the ambiance of the 17th century. The modern bathroom appeared to be recently renovated and provided us with the luxurious amenities one finds in any five star hotel. Windows that opened allowed us views over Campo Santa Sofia as well as side views of the Grand Canal and the gondola station. After spending many hours walking the districts in Venice, we concluded that the Ca Sagredo location on the Grand Canal was perfect for us. The Piazza San Marco, in the heart of the tourist area, was always congested and filled with tourists and tour groups. Piazzale Roma, the area that includes conventional transportation (roads and rails), was also extremely busy. The Ca Sagredoâ€™s central location between Piazza San Marco and Piazzale Roma was much quieter yet, within a couple of minutes, we were in the shopping area on the way to the Rialto Bridge. There were many trattorias and other eateries for when we wanted to leave the hotel. We had a fabulous chefâ€™s choice dinner created by Chef Klostermaier at the Ca Sagredo Lâ€™Alcova restaurant. We would definitely book the hotel again. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Staying in a Palace”
Reviews.Author: RonCanuck
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in this palace and it was really a once in a lifetime experience. This converted palace is in a wonderful location directly on the Grand Canal within easy walking distance of the major tourist sites and within 100 yards of a water taxi stop. The hotel was the former palace of the Sagredo family and the history of many of the large suites is provided. We booked a normal room but our suite was the largest and most magnificent of the hundreds of hotels we have stayed at during the last 25 years. The hotel (palace) seems like it has less than 10 rooms so the service from check-in to check-out is friendly and excellent. A lovely breakfast buffet was provided, including a glass of proseco if desired. The fitness room was decent having a few aerobic machines including bike, treadmill and elliptical - all having wonderful views of the grand canal while working out. Our booking was made with Luxurylink.com and during the off season which made the rate paid seem like a bargain for such a unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Life in The Museum”
Reviews.Author: D1MV
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very pleasant ambience. It's like you travel in time, back in some XVII century. Do visit this hotel as it looks like it won't sand for a long time. Yes, it is quite sad as we noticed a few serious crackings in one of the biggest and most beautiful halls of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly superb Venetian weekend”
Reviews.Author: haem67
Reviews.Content: Just back from from a truly wonderful weekend break in true Venetian luxury. We were upgraded without even asking to room with a splendid view of the Canal. Champagne and chocolates to welcome us and a lovely room overall. Breakfast was ample for Europe... Even had Prosecco included. Had dinner in the restaurant on our first night; food and service cannot be faulted. Convenient vapporetto stop. Helpful friendly staff. Will definitely go back and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lo W
Reviews.Content: Ca'Segrado is a lovely stay in Venice. It is a luxury boutique hotel, that really gives the feel for Venetian life in prior centuries. Our room was spacious and very elegant. It is a bit off the touristy area, which is actually good because there are some decent restaurants nearby... about a 8-10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge and 20 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Cassie1314
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay there very much! It was very well located. The room was super spacious! A great hotel if you love something with a historical touch. The dinner we had at the hotel was fantastic! Best mussels we had in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Palace stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravlChick
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Ca Sagredo in August 2011. We had a junior suite that was absolutely phenomenal. The breakfast rooms are beautiful in their own right - beautiful murals and elegance and a good European breakfast. The staff is knowledgeable and aims to please. The bathroom of the suite was large and well appointed with plenty of towels and good toiletries. The location of Ca Sagredo is convenient - right on the Grand Canal and very near Rialto bridge. It is easiest to take the Traghetto that is right outside the door of the hotel if you want to go across the canal, rather than wind your way through the Rialto bridge. All in all this was a lovely place to stay in a good location without being too close to the throngs of people at St Marks. This is not a budget place to stay, however, but is a beautiful palacial experience. One note - it advertises that is has an exercise room, but when I inquired, the staff indicated that it was "just an old bike in a room downstairs" and they didn't even want to show it to me. They encouraged me to go on the "organized jogging event each morning". They apparently have someone that takes groups each morning on a run through the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Val and Lu S
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at the Ca'Sagredo celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary. The suite was amazing with a fantastic view. The staff were excellent, very helpful and always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful right on the canal. The room was very large and was elegantly furnished. The breakfast buffet was fabulous too. It was a little bit out of the way...but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute, Amazing Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mulberry08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August when we returned from a Med cruise on the Seabourn Quest. This Hotel was totally amazing we loved every minute of being there. The staff were exceptional and the food fantastic. We decided to let the chief feed us (choose the menu) one night and he produced the most amazing meal. It was fantastic. We ate on the veranda on the main Canal it was the most special experience. Unlike the other 5* hotels you were actually on the waters edge. Watching the world go by. It was not the most expensive Hotel but I think the best. The food and drink was not that expensive. Had a nice bottle of champagne in my room on my Birthday! Thank you everyone! We are definitely going to return. Venice - Did not smell at all! Was not expensive and was not that crowded (no different to shopping on a Saturday) do not believe any negative rumours until you go there yourself! Totally amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 Star is Venice”
Reviews.Author: STR001
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 2 November by water taxi at 09h00 and were greeted at the taxi by the hotel staff. Check in was very quick and we were immediately shown to our room even though it was just after 09h00 in the morning. The suite (room 202) is situated on the second floor â€“The Library Suite. You enter this room from the main â€œHallâ€�. This suite is situated in the old library and has a double volume ceiling with a magnificent Murano class chandelier. The room is filled with antique furniture and has a beautiful view on the Grand Canal. There is a guest cloakroom in the entrance hall and the bathroom is situated on the same level as the upper part of the library â€“ this was great for us, but people with a walking disability or not willing to climb stairs, should book one of the other suites. Having stayed in Venice before we really think this is the best location to stay at. The Traghetto crossing to the Rialto Market is right at the front of the door and the Ca' d'Oro Vaporetto stop is just round the corner. Walking to St Markâ€™s square is about 15 minutes. This area is also much quieter and not so overrun by tourists, but by no means quiet. There are also great restaurants nearby. We had drinks and canapÃ©s on the hotel deck overlooking the canal every evening before we went out for dinner. The service here was top notch! Breakfast was more than adequate and GREAT for Europe. We arranged for a late checkout at 17h00 (at time of booking), which also was not a problem and wonderfully handled. The hotel organized our taxis to and from the airport â€“ I would recommend this, as it removes any hassles getting to and from the airport. No extra charges were levied by the hotel for booking the water taxi on our behalf. We loved our spectacular room; the service was great and the location unmatched. What we did not like, was leaving this wonderful establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Ca'Sagredo: Outstanding Hotel and Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CorpGypsy
Reviews.Content: Booked a partial deluxe canal view room on Otel.com for a 2 night stay in mid-October. Our room had a beautiful side view of the canal and the gondola stop. While at first we were concerned about noise being above the main entry, the soundproofing of the room was excellent. The larger-than-expected room was beautifully furnished with a very comfortable king bed, a sofa, side chairs and a desk. Wall coverings and fabrics were very high end. Reception was formal, friendly and cordial. We had a very early morning departure and the night manager made sure we had coffee and breakfast at 5:00 am. The real surprise was their terrace and restaurant, L'Alcova. We had our two light lunches on the terrace and were spellbound by the views of the canal, the oustanding service by GianPaolo and his team and the quality of the food. Dinner at their formal restaurant was the highlight of our stay. There are only six tables looking out on the Grand Canal. The food, presentation and service was our best in Europe. It's expensive, but worth the price! We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valeriecheshire
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! A real re-furbished Venetian palace it certainly took you back in time. to be able to stand on the balcony right on the Grand Canal was truly a delight. A lovely buffet breakfast served in the ballroom accompanied by Italian classical music certainly added to the ambience. A great location and great restaraunt recommendations from the helpful reception staff all added to a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hot in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PMB4
Reviews.Content: Sept 23-28 was a hot time to be in Venice, but the air conditioning and everything else was in great working order at Ca' Segredo! We had that familiar exciting feeling of seeing the Grand Canal from the train station and then having our water taxi pull up to the private dock at the hotel. We were whisked away to room #104 - a deluxe jr suite with full Grand Canal views. It was beautifully appointed with a couch, 2 chairs, a large desk and chair and 3 windows on the Canal. I could open the windows and watch the traffic on the Canal and the Gondoliers unpack their gondolas every morning because they had parked them underneath the hotel windows. We loved that our room was low and close to the water. The staff was wonderful; we loved the music at breakfast every morning; their advice for restaurants in walking distance was spot on and we cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm O
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed for four nights in what has to be one of the finest, friendliest and most amazing hotels, and not just in Venice. First off, there was the marbled pillared entrance hall, the fantastic marble main staircase, the public rooms with paintings on ceilings and walls, and the general ambience of living in a former palace. The staff, whether on reception, in the restaurant or the porters or the chambermaids, were without exception friendly and helpful. We had two evening meals - candlelit on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal - with wonderful food and wine - the recommendations of local wines that I asked for were spot on to accompany our meal. Our room, with its own small terrace, was very well appointed and comfortable. If we return to Venice, this will be our hotel of choice. It is brilliantly situated on the Grand Canal, with a vaporetto stop close by, and a traghetto by the entrance which takes you across the Grand Canal in a gondola for 50 cents. As a base for seeing all the sights of Venice it could not be bettered. Following a recommendation already made on TripAdvisor, we ate at the exceptionally good fish restaurant a couple of hundred metres away - al Fontego dei Pecaori - and had fantastic fresh fish bought from the fish market (on the other side of the Grand Canal from the hotel and well worth visiting) just that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Best service, and location in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Randy B
Reviews.Content: I spent a total of seven nights in CaÊ» Sagredo Hotel, in the heart of Venice. The staff was fabulous! The location was perfect! Next to the front door, is the water-taxi gondola which will bring you to the incredible Rialto Market for less than a dollar. I even went shopping at the market accompanied by the great Chef Josef Klostermeier, who helped me select the perfect seafood, which he prepared for my dinner with friends that same evening. This was an ideal "first extended visit" for me, to Venice. Top tier all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: OlgaM M
Reviews.Content: Casagredo was our first stop on our honeymoon, and the most appalling holiday experience up to date. At arrival, there was no one at the entrance, and we had to carry the bags ourselves into hotel lobby. Once checked in we found out that there is no room service after 11, and thus no tea or coffee is available at all after the journey. Our room though very nice and luxurious (we had a junior suit) was unbelievably cold. With me being a little sick we asked to increase the temperature (which was 18 degrees at the time!), but we were told that no heating was available at that time of the year. We did ask a couple of times as I was shivering in bed, but to no avail. Next morning they changed the room, and did switch the underfloor heating, but no apology or discount was offered. When we said that we were extremely disappointed with service, we were told that all we said was a lie! I was so upset I wrote my comments down in the comment book in the lobby, which was shamelessly taken away 2 min later. After this our room was stuffy hot, but we never complained as it was just too tiring to argue with them. On the last night we asked for some tea ~11, only to be told that tea is still available, but we need to go down and bring to the room ourselves. Overall, incredibly disappointed, would never return, and would very much advise against staying at casagredo- it doesn't deserve the 5 stars it's got and the very expensive bill.

Reviews.Title: “A Not-So-Hidden Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NH_Guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a King Room overlooking the Grand Canal. The room was quite spacious and comfortable, and the restoration of this 15th century residence was done tastefully and well. To complement this beautiful property, the service was timely and professional, and the food (we had an "American" breakfast every morning) was nicely prepared. The strongest pro: the location is a quick turn off of the tourist throngs and is right next to a convenient gondola crossing. Seriously, the noise level went down 90% when you turned toward the hotel entrance. The strongest con: the claustrophobic elevator with a mind of its own, which established a new reason to take the stairs. Great place, all around.

Reviews.Title: “Palace living right on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Roni4451
Reviews.Content: Loved this boutique hotel from the moment we walked in. The hotel retains the main historic rooms and eating breakfast with opera in the background is a treat and one feels like a visitor from another era. Our suite was very large and quiet, with wonderful bathroom amenities. Our favorite meals in Venice were in the hotels' beautiful L'Alcova restaurant, where we had a lunch, aperitifs and dinner. We were superbly served in the restaurant by a seasoned waiter ( Jean Paul?) who's gracious service really enhanced our meals on the lovely outdoor terrace. Our only regret is that the hotel did not seem to do all that it could in order to retrieve our baggage from Milan, and we waited 3 full days without luggage, and no one seemed particularly helpful , useful or even interested in helping us retrieve it or offer help with making us comfortable without our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BraddyNrFrome
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel - well positioned on the Grand Canal in Venice. The receptionist / consierge was superb, very friendly and helpful. The whole staff were knowledgeable and very friendly. The building itself was stunning with some superb art works ont he ceilings and walls. The restaurant was excellent food although a little expensive Â£100 per head before wine but a great setting on the terrace overlooking the grand canal. Take a canal or street view room otherwise you'll end up viewing another wall or window. The only disappointment was the breakfast, would have hoped that for a five star hotel it could have been prepared for you - not a buffet that had stood for a while - bread and croissants not that fresh - no freshly cooked eggs - Otherwise excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like royalty! Be treated like a queen!”
Reviews.Author: sylvager
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ca Segredo at the end of a Seabourn cruise and, on arrival, found an Australian couple whom we had met on board had also chosen it. All of us loved this magnificent hotel. We took a water taxi from the port on arrival and another to the airport and it was well worth it for the convenience. Our suite was on the first floor overlooking the Grand Canal and it was spacious, beautifully furnished and well-serviced every day. It was a little noisy but worth it for the views and the ambience. Staff at Reception were helpful, provided excellent maps and advice on how to get where we wanted to go. We were pleased with breakfast, having expected a continental one, but there was a good selection and the staff were very friendly.The sublime music played during breakfast created a wonderful atmosphere. To stay in a Palazzo with its Grand Ballroom, Music Room and sweeping staircase was a memorable experience. The location is perfect as the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square are within easy walking distance and there is a gondola ferry service to the other side of the Canal (don't miss the early morning Rialto Market), in addition to the private jetty and public water transport just outside. The hotel restaurant is beautiful and we also loved nearby Osteria Ae Sconte close to the Rialto Bridge. It is difficult to find on your first visit but ask for the Canaletto Hotel which is beside it. If we go back to Venice we will certainly stay again in Ca Sagredo.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MichaelChew
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ca 'Sagredo in Venice for 3 days as part of a family holiday, returning to London on the Venice Simplon Orient Express. Not easy to get to the hotel by public water taxi as one then needs to find one's way via the windy roads to the hotel. Much better to go by private water taxi as this stops just at the hotel pier.The hotel is a grand and beautiful building converted from a previous large stately home, right in the centre of Venice near the Rialto bridge. My brother's family had the room with a roof terrace, providing fantastic views of Venice. Our room had a verandah. Great hotel restaurant right by the canal, where one can have a leisurely meal watching the gondolas go by. Very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sightseer67
Reviews.Content: At the end of August my husband and I spent five days in Venice staying at the Caâ€™Sagredo Hotel. We loved everything about this hotel: a beautiful Venetian Palazzo in a great location and friendly, helpful staff. It is great value for money as it is located on the Grand Canal, right next door to the Caâ€™dâ€™Oro Museum and it is an excellent base from which to explore Venice and, best of all, you can avoid the day trippers in St Markâ€™s Square. The breakfast service we found to be on a par with our experience of other good hotels elsewhere in Italy in that, fresh coffee/tea is brought to your table and you help yourself to a range of food from a buffet table: juice, fresh fruit, cereal, scrambled/boiled eggs, bacon, sausage, cold meats and cheese. The Rialto Markets are directly across the Canal and can be reached by a shared gondola (Traghetto). Even on the hottest August days there wasnâ€™t s whiff of fish - a complaint made in another review. Our first floor room, which had a side canal view (overlooking the Traghetto landing point) was quiet, spacious, furnished to a high standard with a large modern bathroom which had a second television (but only one English language tv news channel). Throughout our stay we found all the staff to be pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. We intend to return to Venice next year and will definitely be staying at the Caâ€™Sagredo - but not in August (never, ever go to Venice in August). NOTE: we can confirm another reviewerâ€™s observation that it is only a ten minute walk from the waterbus stop Fondamenta Nove to the hotel. Cost from Airport 15 euros (25 euros return) compared to 100+ euros by water taxi. The most direct route: 1. alight at Ft Nove turn right and then turn left into Calle Marco Foscarini 2. walk to end and turn right into Fondamenta S. Caterina 3. at end turn left, crossing over the bridge and walk to end, crossing a second bridge. 4. at end turn left and with a few steps you are in a small open area facing into Strada Nove. 5. turn left in Strada Nove and in one minute you reach Caâ€™Sagredo in the Campo Santa Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive surroundings, lovely room but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Kate11853
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and impressive building and our room, although in effect in the roof space, was lovely - - - cool, spacious, very clean and beautifully serviced by the housekeeping staff. There was a minor problem with the TV service, which was limited. You can choose an English language option from the main menu, but this only gave us access to a couple of news channels, both of which were CNN based, and to a Eurosport channel where the commentary was in German. We asked at Reception why we could not access the Sky News option on this menu and the receptionist said he would investigate this for us whilst we were out for the day. When we returned, we could still not access this service but we received no feedback from the receptionist as to why. We explored other options, perhaps thinking we would watch a film (whilst resting during a very hot day) from the 'Blockbusters' menu, but the 14 euros to be charged for a film like 'Gladiator' ( c.10 years old?) put us off! There was also a significant charge if you wanted to listen to any music from the main menu. There was good free wi-fi access, though. The other problem was the breakfast service, which we found to be only average. On our last morning, we had a very early one as we had to catch a train at 8.30 am. Everything was available and ready at 7.00 am but the scrambled egg I had was cold, as was the bacon and sausage chosen by my husband. This made us question when the food had actually been prepared, as we were the first people down to eat that day. The basic breakfast cost was included in our 'package' but we saw from the a la carte breakfast menu that other nice choices were available, such as omelette, porridge, or even fried eggs - for which you would need to pay at least 10 euros!! The waitresses were lovely, though, and very friendly, whereas the reception staff, although always professional, tended to be rather 'cool'. Charges for services other than those previously paid for at the time of booking are excessive, we felt. We paid 26 euros for 1 small snack from the mini-bar, 1 cup of coffee and 1 small bourbon from the main bar. The location of the hotel is lovely and its architecture and the pervading sense of history are awe-inspiring. However, I doubt that we would return, as value for money is significant for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Blue1231
Reviews.Content: There were 14 of us on a family trip. The Hotel is breath-takingly beautiful, and is in a superb location at the Ca d'Oro Watertaxi stop. The staff is wonderful, and the service never ended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Dubson
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights from July 12th. The hotel is even more beautiful than as seen on its website. A former Dogo (Duke) palace, it is an architectural and art jewel. The two rooms were accordingly elegantly furnished. The location, close to the Ca' D'Oro, is so much preferable to San Marco; it is far from mass tourism, and the nearby main street is full with fine shops and restaurants. Our reservation included a market shopping and cuisine class with the excellent chef Josef Klostermaier, a great event for our two boys.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay in our memory for ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: garrylt6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for our Honeymoon. The hotel upgraded us, gave us complementry cocktails and canopies and provided us with anything we asked. Beyond doubt this is a five star hotel. Different to the 5 dtar hotels I've frequented in England, Dubai, Australia etc as its not ultra modern or sleek. It is like a museum, full of antiques and characters that sets itself apart from all the other modern 5 star hotels around the world (don't get me wrong, I like ultra modern sleek hotels). I reccomend you google this hotel to appreciate its history and what it has to offer. From famous painting, the hall of the falling giants, the ball room, even our hotel room was a piece of art work. Location is right on the grand canal with beautiful views. About 25 minute walk to st Marks square but far away enough to avoid the tourist trap bars and restaurants. In summary, if you appreciate what the hotel is, like us, you will have a memorable stay that will be remembered for the rest of your days, you'll remember when and where you were when you stayed in this hotel due to its individuality and character. I would certainly reccomend but probably not visit for a while as venice is expensive but justified spending sily amounts as I was on my honey moon! regards Garry

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel,a great choice for anyone visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: McVeighs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two friends stayed at the Ca'Sagredo for three nights at the end of March.A beautiful hotel within a walking distance from St. Marks Square but far enough away from the crowds.There were plenty of restaurants near the hotel.Lovely breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL BUT...”
Reviews.Author: mbutterfly1977
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel from the moment I saw its interior online. We decided to stay there to give it a try last time we went to Venice. I loved its interiors. We got the most incredible, presidential suit with huge room and the view on Grand Canal = interior worth the price. I loved everything - breakfasts, service etc however the floor in the room was made of something that during the winters makes the room very cold at nights and we were not able to control the thermostat (only concierge had an access to it). Besides that I could not understand how such an expensive hotel did not provide us with the free access to the Internet (Europe is so behind with it). Other than that I loved the hotel but we are not enough impressed to come back there. We decided to try other since there are so plenty of beautiful hotels in this gorgeous city.

Reviews.Title: “Such a shame the staff let this beautiful palace down”
Reviews.Author: RichelleAnne
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the hotel were wonderful. As were we treated off the water taxi and led into the salon. The first problem started when I wouldn't let the front desk staff take my passport. They wanted to take in from me and return in latter to the room. As a seasoned traveller I will never leave my passport with anyone. I politely told the front desk staff that I would rather he photocopy it right now and give in back to me. I was very abruptly told that it's not policy but he would hold up everyone and the process 'for my unreasonable demands'. Latter that night we had tickets to the opera. We discovered that my husbands suit and my gown were horribly crushed I called gown to housekeeping for an iron. I was told that being a palace we were not allowed to plug and appliances in but he would sort it out for him. Happy with the response the clothes were collected and returned latter ironed. It wasn't until checkout that we discovered a â‚¬100 bill on checkout for pressing. I was appalled and told the manager so. He informed my husband that we had obviously spent little time in Europe because all pressing was charged. My problem is no one ever told us we would be charged. That same night my husband got very sick. On calling down to the front desk for assistance we had a language problem. I went down to find someone that could help me. Visibly upset I was told to try back in the morning when someone was on that spoke English. I find this very strange in a five star hotel. I was left wandering the streets of Venice looking for a chemist. There are much better hotels in Venice. It is such a shame because the rooms were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BASLJM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca Segredo Hotel in Venice for 4 nights in June 2011. This was part of a nine-week European trip where we stayed in 12 hotels (primarily 5 star). We almost always stay in a Four Seasons Hotel when available and our review should be assessed in this light. The Ca Segrado is a beautiful little hotel located about a 10-15 minute walk from both the train station and St. Mark's Square. It is a former Noble House with large rooms and bathrooms. The room is furnished with beautiful period pieces of high quality and that are also surprisingly functional. The air conditioning was quiet and efficient. The shower and bathtub were combined but it was large and easy to use. The hotel has a fantastic little bar looking directly onto the canal. While the drinks are expensive, they provide excellent snacks. The head waiter is charming. It is a fantastic place to have a drink (or two!) before heading out to dinner. The breakfasts at the hotel were among the best that we had in Europe and are provided in a beautiful room with exceptionally high ceilings. Unlike most other holels, scrambled and hard boiled eggs were included. The staff are friendly and helpful, and come close to levels provided by the Four Seasons Hotels. In short, the Ca Segrado is a great place to stay and, given the relatively few reviews on TA, is a hidden gem in Venice. Some tips: 1. There is an excellent gelato store located about 2 blocks from the hotel. It is called "Grom". From the side entrance, walk back to the main street and turn left. it is about 2-3 blocks away on the right side of the road. The gelato is made fresh daily on the premises. 2. There are two really good restaurants close by. The first is Trattoria Ca d'Oro, located at Calle Ca d'Oro 3912, about 2 blocks from the hotel (and not too far from Grom's). It is a small family restaurant with a limited menu but excellent. Dinner for three was about 75 euros (excellent value)! The other is Fiaschetteria Toscana, located at San Giovanni Grisitomo 5719, about a 10 minute walk from the hotel on the main walking street just past the Rialto Bridge. All food was good but ask the waiter for his recommendation. Price was about 200 euros for 3 people. Reservations for both restaurants are a must. 3. From the train station, the water taxi to the hotel took 10 minutes and cost 50 euros 4. Laundry is very expensive. There is a coin laundromat on Ruga Giuffa, very close to S. Maria Formosa. It was about 10 minutes from the hotel and 5 minutes from St. Mark's Square. 5. Do the gondola early, before 9:30 am. After that, there are far too many on the water and the charm of the ride is lost by the very crowded waterways. We paid 80 euros for a 40 minute ride. Prices seem to be pretty standard. 6. While the Rialto Bridge is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel, you can cross the canal using a "gondola ferry" right in front of the Ca Segregado Hotel. Cost is only 0.5 euro per person and takes about 2 minutes. There is a fantastic open-air food market right across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Romantic, Clean, Friendly, Conveninent spot!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelersHNM
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend a better hotel.. honeymoon trip started in Venice, and was the best hotel we stayed at in all of Italy. Deluxe is a huge size room, with large bathroom, very luxurious and worth the price, rest assured. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Water taxis right around the corner, and gondola rides right outside the hotel. Perfect stay! The view wasn't the best from our hotel room, but from the top of hotel was nice.. decent breakfast also. But overall, extremely comfortable and slept like a baby, A Must Stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff/ excellent food/”
Reviews.Author: Goss5
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Rialto Bridge , but remarkably quiet. Traghetti stop outside hotel, cheap Gondola ride across Grand Canal to the produce market. Vaporetti stop very close to hotel brilliant for getting around Venice, buy a three day pass and save the legs!.Hotel staff helpful ,great hotel. Would avoid Venice in late July due to crowds

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: mills2108
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner visited this hotel about a year ago as a surprise I booked a weekend in Venice and after some research I decided to book the Caâ€™Sagredo. I must say we certainly werenâ€™t disappointed, it is a beautiful hotel and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. This is where I proposed to my partner and the hotel organised the gondola ride for me and took care of all the details. It was decided that we would return to Venice to get married and what better than to stay at the caâ€™sagrado again. After contacting them about this they were extremely helpful in helping us organise everything as we wanted to hold the reception at the hotel also. From the start all the way through they were fantastic!! Upon arrival which was quite late at night, we were shown to our room number 316. When we entered we were both overwhelmed with the room it was absolutely beautiful and they couldnâ€™t have picked a better room for us. All throughout our stay the management and staff including Elisabeth who dealt with everything for us were amazing and the attention to detail and the service we received was second to none! NOTHING was too much trouble. We was even able to taste the food from the menu we had chosen which we did the day after arriving for lunchâ€¦.the food was out of this world, the chef came and spoke to us about it and discussed the ingredients etc. On the day of the wedding 4th July the housekeeper arrived early to tidy the room (which they done about twice a day without delay or asking) to then allow the photographer to take pictures. The hotel organised all our transport etc and gondolas for the day also. Upon returning from the ceremony at the Palazzo Cavalli our guests were treated to canapÃ©s and champagne. Again the service from the staff was second to none with us receiving a glass and a greeting from the manager. After this we went to the music room for the meal where the tables were decorated beautifully and the food was served with some background music. All throughout the meal the waiters were extremely attentive, filling glasses etc etc and the food was amazing, all the guests commented on the food. We also had children who had the adult menu but wanted to change to the childrenâ€™s menu on the day and even this was no problem and was done without fuss. After the meal etc and when myself and my bride returned to the hotel there was a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us. During our stay the staff even took the time out to explain the history of the hotel and show us around various parts which the gentlemen did because he had an interest which you could tell, this again was a lovely touch. The day after our wedding we had to check out as we had booked the final 2 days at another 5star luxury hotel, and to be honest we wish we could of stayed at the Caâ€™Sagredo (we even asked them before we left if we could) All in all an AMAZING experience and the staff were all amazing, kind and friendly who always had a smile, where nothing was too much trouble and the service we received was not forced or fake if you know what I mean. A HUGE thank you to all the staff at the Caâ€™Sagredo from Mr and Mrs Mills room 316. Ps WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for sightseeing in Venice with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller073
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful palace on the Grand Canal. We arrived by water taxi from the station - definately the best way to arrive as the taxi takes you to the front door. Our room had beautiful views over the Grand Canal and was nicely furnished. The staff were all very helpful and nothing was too much bother for them. The breakfast was good - a wide selection of cold and hot food. You need to reserve to get a table on the terrace for dinner. We ate inside - food was OK?good but a bit pricey. Some portions were small and even the waitress suggested we avoided one dessert as it was small - wish I'd taken her advice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Tiepolo ceilings, but over-rated and often unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Polonius45
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Ca' Sagredo for 4 nights in July. The hotel is in a good location, overlooking the Grand Canal, by the Ca' d'Oro, and has some wonderful Tiepolo ceilings, but apart from that it was a great disappointment. When we arrived by water-taxi and were taken to the reception desk, instead of the expected "Welcome to the Ca' Segredo, Mr...?", the attendant barked "Do you have a reservation?" The service was uninspiring, and in some instances positively rude (a door was slammed in our faces by a passing porter). The food in the restaurant was good but, although there were only a few other diners, it took well over an hour for us to get our first course. We could not change the air conditioning in our room, and were surprised to be told that it was centrally controlled. A polite email to the manager received a reply that failed to deal with my main criticisms. If you want a true 5 star hotel in Venice, I would suggest many others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Calypso007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just a week ago with my family and we were absolutely charmed from the start. We arrived by water taxi and got off right at the hotel's own launch. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly, in particular I must mention Signor Gianpolo, whom we met in the restaurant and who was very helpful and entertaining. The rooms are spacious and light and we enjoyed sitting in our windows and watching the square below where people drifted around all day and where gondola's ferried us across to the Rialto market. There is internet available, though I was not able to make use of it. There is no mini-bar, but we didn't miss it at all. There is a very small fitness room I used once, but I heard they will be building a larger one in the near future. The breakfast buffet is vast offering everything you might want and held in the beautiful second floor of this restored palazzo. All in all, I felt it offered a welcome respite for our weary feet after days of treking around the city and we left feeling we would love to come back in the very near future!

Reviews.Title: “Broken A/C - But a First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuonaNotteRoma
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for four nights at the Ca Sagredo with my wife and two daughters (ages 15 and 12). This being our first trip to Venice and expecting warmer June climes I wanted a classic hotel in a top notch location (on the Grand Canal) with modern amenities (i.e. A/C). I knew in advance that prices in Venice this time of year would be exorbitant at any hotel â€“ so I just want â€˜all inâ€™ and booked the 5*L Ca Sagredo, beautifully situated across from the Rialto Market on the Grand Canal. We reserved one double room with a canal view and one double room without. The hotel service, location and appearance all live up to my expectations of a 5*L hotel. The Ca Sagredo has an intimate and Venetian dÃ©corâ€¦with a beautiful marble lobby and staircase. The staff is very attentive and helpful, assisting us with: terminal-to-hotel transfer instructions, dry cleaning/laundry, general advice about Venice and even recommending a tour of the Rialto Market with the hotelâ€™s Executive Chef. Weâ€™re an English speaking family that attempts to engage in the local tongue during our stayâ€¦and the staff remained helpful and patient with (humored by?) our attempts to speak Italian. We arrived via train at the St. Lucia Terminal and took the water taxi (cost: 50 Euros) to the hotelâ€¦the other option is walking or taking the Vaporetto to the Ca Dâ€™oro Stop (right next door to the hotel..which BTW is a MUST-SEE museum). We really liked the hotelâ€™s location, as it was a little bit off the main walking routes and largest tourist-masses on Venice. We are walking-tourists so it fit our mode-of-operation perfectly. The hotel is about: 15 minutes walk from St. Markâ€™s Square, 5 minutes from Rialto Bridge, 15 minutes from the Ghetto and about 30 minutes from the Gallerie del Academia. The rooms were beautifully appointed, beds were comfortable andâ€¦one of the air conditioners worked as needed. Unfortunately, and the staff didn't acknowledge there was truly a problem, the A/C in our kids room wasnâ€™t working properly for the entire stay. The front desk was cooperative and tried restarting the system several times but the A/C wouldnâ€™t kick in. The room cooled down a bit at night, but for the 5*L and the priceâ€¦I expected a more proactive response to the problem. The A/C issue notwithstanding, I would return in a heartbeat to the Ca Sagredoâ€¦it is a first class hotel in a beautiful location. I just would make sure that if I was in Room 107, the air conditioner was working.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sharon4101
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this wonderful hotel and already planning to return to it! The staff are brilliant, the rooms are really nice and spacious. We ate on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and the chef came out and spoke to us personally about our meal! Breakfast is served in the most amazing surroundings and maybe could have had a wide choice of hot food? The hotel is very well placed for the water buses and has a private dock also. I have been to Venice many times and never returned to the same hotel - but I will return to this hotel and book a junior suite next time for a canal view. I cant recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: feebib
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel. It is in a very good location for the water bus. Rooms are stunning and whole atmosphere very Venetian. The original library of the palazzo has even been converted to a bedroom. We had dinner one evening on the terrace which was excellent. Staff there and also Laura at reception all excellente !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: traveledfar
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely suite on the overlooking the grand hotel. Breakfast was good in magnificent surroundings. The restaurant created the best mussels I have ever eaten. I ate them for dinner and then again for lunch a couple of days later. Restaurant is also very lovely overlooking the canal. Very convenient to take water taxi from their dock.

Reviews.Title: “Palace overlooking Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: lynrod
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel as part of a package with a trip on the Orient Express. We were shown to a Junior Suite instead of double we booked- two lounge areas, vast double bed, dressing room and spacious bathroom. No tea/ coffee facilities only drawback. Breakfast is hot and cold buffet served in a Palace with opera music as background. Close to Rialto bridge, waterbus stop and easy walking distance to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of Venice”
Reviews.Author: rplacido
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Ca Sagredo was one of the highlights to our vacation in Italy. The staff did a fantastic job of making our stay extremely comfortable from arranging restaurant reservations, water taxi rides, glass shopping trip to Murano, 4 hour private guide (Silvia) - they are hospitable, friendly, and a pleasure to interact with. By far the most amazing experience was the private cooking class by Chef Klostermaier. A four course meal prepared side by side with the chef and enjoyed in his kitchen. Each meal was delicious as only fresh ingredients were used which we happened to select while shopping with the chef in the market earlier in the day. The rooms are spacious with lavish appointments and the location of the hotel makes convenient to walk almost anywhere. I highly recommend and only hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “"It couldn't have be any better".”
Reviews.Author: jonels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a short week here. Everything was so perfect. The splendour of the hotel (it's got to be seen to be believed) and its staff and setting. Grand Canal, gondolas, piazza's, Italian ice cream, restaurants, shopping etc, all on your doorstep, but quietly. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Ca'Sagredo Luxury”
Reviews.Author: pip45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca'sagredo for 3 nights in a Junior suite. We chose to arrive in style so took the private water taxi from Marco polo directly to the terrace of the hotel on the Grand Canal. From the moment we arrived the staff we efficient, ploite and very informative. Our suite was unfortunately at the back of the hotel and not overlooking the canal, a pity but not a deal breaker. The rooms in the hotel are beautiful and breakfast was taken in the adjoining room to the large music room, there was always a good selection of food on offer. The terrace was perfect for dinner or drinks as it looks over the Grand canal towards the Rialto market on the far bank. One morning we went with the chef to the market where he was buying the food for lunch and dinner. The great thing about the hotels location is that you are way from the tourist trap of St Mark's but within easy access if you so wish. fantastic and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: N1C
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 5 night stay in a junior suite. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are excellent. The hotel is in a great location away from the hustle and bustle of St Marks but whithin easy reach of everything. As the previous reviewer mentions the hotel has its own landing dock. The Gondolas are just out side, you can of course do the gondola ride but also for 0.50â‚¬ (if you cant be botherd to walk) you can get to the Rialto across the Grand Canal where there are some lovely canal side resturants. The Ca d Oro water bus stop is also just by the hotel which is very convenient. Would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent splendour”
Reviews.Author: GarethC3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Citalia and when we arrived we were upgraded to a canal view suite. A fabulous room, very comfortable bed and a view straight out on to the Grand Canal that was to die for. Staff were wonderful and one of them took time out to show us the amazing frescos. The building used to belong to the 100th Doge. Breakfast was excellent and we always took time to walk through to the ballroom/music room with our coffee after breakfast to soak up the wonderful ambience and baroque music that was played through a decent sound system. Location was very convenient for the water bus or if your are not bothered about the cost of taxis, the hotel has it own jetty. It is also right next to a gondola hire point. St Mark's Square is only approx 10 minutes walk, the only problem being to resist the delicious icecream that is available en route. This was a holiday to remember and made so much more special by being able to stay in this superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: TheKiwiWanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' Sagredo over the Easter Break. Its location provided us with the much needed break from the activity of Venice. While only a couple of minutes away from Rialto Bridge, we elected to use the gondola crossing next to the hotel. This made for a quick and authentic crossing to the other side of the Grand Canal while sparing us the congestion of the Rialto Bridge. The staff was attentive, the suite was spacious and well appointed, and the generously sized bathroom was impeccably clean. We had a lovely view of the Venice rooftops with a sideways glimpse of the Grand Canal. The stucco details and frescoes of the suite made for a most unique experience. In fact this cared for 14th century palazzo is a testament to the skill of Venetian artisans. The only criticism of the suite was caused by the poor quality of insulation of the connecting door between us and the room next door . Sadly our neighbours suffered from jet lag and their conversation, while conducted in a moderate tone, was clearly audible to us well into the small hours of the morning. No such insulation issue existed where a wall separated the suite from another room. Free wifi was provided however the signal from the suite was very weak and often unavailable. In itself this was not a major problem as it allowed us to enjoy the 2nd floor museum like spaces while using the internet. The breakfast buffet was well appointed with a large variety of quality products and very good service. Overall, Ca' Sagredo provided us with a wonderful and memorable experience and am happy to recommend to any traveller in search of an authentic Venetian experience with first class modern amenities and service.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay on Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MrsWard88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca Sagredo with the final part of our Honeymoon. It's in a wonderful location, very central to everything. It's a beautiful hotel, very romantic setting with stunning rooms on floor two (breakfast floor). The staff are extremely helpful and very welcoming. Breakfast was great, plenty of variety. Rooms where clean and the bathroom is spacey. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Juan_Eduardo_Andrade
Reviews.Content: Well...one of the best hotel i ever stayed. The location is fantastic (just 5 minutes walking to the Rialto bridge), and there is also a vaporeto stop near the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel we saw it was special. We were welcome by the staff right away and the young girl that was at the reception show us the hotel (that looks like a palazzo) and tell us a about the history of the 13th century hotel. The rooms are great and the restaurant is also good. If possible ask for a room with a Grand Canal view! it's worth it it was simply fantastic. Next time i will stay in this same hotel, no dout! A piece of history, wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Really amazing!”
Reviews.Author: crushzwei
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights last week (April 20 and 21). Staff was very kind, friendly. Room was very comfortable and the hotel really looks like a palazzo! Breakfast was very good, but not excellent as in other hotels which I stayed at before.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: tzvitas
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Venice over the weekend was enhanced dramatically with staying at this hotel. Everything is perfect and beautiful. The staff is great and friendly! Very comfortable rooms. Just wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Lovely...but”
Reviews.Author: reynards2
Reviews.Content: Booked via Citalia who upgraded from classic to prestige..room was fabulous, although very noisy, lovely bathroom, lounge area and bedroom, but NO coffee facilities! which surprised me in view of the cost. Breakfast was disappointing, basic standard choices, and if you went down at 930am most of the bacon and eggs had been eaten! with no replacement. This hotel is in a central location which is excellent, the staff are helpful, BUT prices are high for coffee or drinks, so make sure you look outside of the hotel. Would I stay again, No as I believe within the area there are other hotels which for the same cost would offer more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon - Many thanks to the staff”
Reviews.Author: Shamce
Reviews.Content: Just like a dream in an italian Palazzio ! Couldn't be better. We just loved it. Everything was perfect to us (rooms, breakfast, diner, location, service, cocktails, decoration ...). We would propably be back for next trip in Venise. It was my 3rd time in Venise, but this time it was just magical ! I strongly recomend it for all the lovers ;-).

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel, excellent service, prime location”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravelIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ca'Sagredo 22 to 25 March with my husband and parents-in-law who are both in their late 70's. The service from arrival to departure was excellent, staff were attentive, they knew who we were when we arrived, the remembered our names and our room numbers without asking, they smiled! Breakfast was of a very good standard with a selection of fresh fruit, youghurts and breads, cereals, juices and cooked eggs, sausages and bacon - and wonderful Italian coffee. Our rooms were out of this world - we received a complimentary upgrade to junior suites through Citalia travel agents and they were HUGE! An entrance hall, dressing room and bathroom in one direction, and then down a small set of steps a living room and giant bedroom with murals and painted ceilings. The rooms were clean and beautifully decorated with sumptuous curtains and bed linen - and such comfortable beds! We had requested a twin room for the parents which was confirmed by email in advance and duly provided. The staff also provided us with advice on several options on how to get to the airport and ordered our taxis for us. Nothing was any trouble for them. Location is just opposite the open air markets on the Grand Canal, a ten minute stroll to the Rialto Bridge and about another ten minutes on to St Marks Square. It was expensive, but everywhere in Venice is, however I would say it was good value for money and we loved every minute of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions...”
Reviews.Author: hallwoodh
Reviews.Content: After all the good TA reviews I had high hopes for our stay at this hotel. BUT. We emailed them twice before our arrival as we had spent rather a lot of money on a premier junior suite for a special occasion so we wanted some idea of room size/view etc. Both emails went unanswered. When we arrive you have to heave yourself and your cases through some pretty hefty doors - no sign of the doorman until it was time to take our cases up to our room and earn himself a couple of euros. Reception is quite heavily manned (about six of them), although we did find ourselves ignored as when we checked in only one other man was checking in but no one acknowledged us, same on check out. No word of thanks or goodbye or have a nice trip or did you have a nice stay etc etc A young girl showed us to our room and literally walked in said "lights' and walked out again, we turned round expecting her to show us the rest of the room but she had disappeared. The rooms are quite nice, our view wasn't. Breakfast was mediocre, just a regular continental breakfast. Very few TV channels in English (OK I know you're not there to watch telly but every other nationality seemed to be catered for). Local calls are not included so we had charges for ringing a couple of restaurants. All this for Â£350 a night! Sorry I have to say we expected a lot more, its a small hotel so a more personal touch would have been appreciated. On a positive note, we were in Venice for the 'Carnevale' which is good fun.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: LukeHeath
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel, spent our anniversary there and was greeted with champagne and chocolates, it was an amazing hotel and great service, staff were extremely helpful with everything. Book through Citalia and it's great price. Went during Carnivale and cannot recommend Venice more, we're a Young couple and had a great time.. Cannot recommend it more!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Cottage02
Reviews.Content: I wonder where the gentleman was staying.......we spent four nights Feb. 15-18th at this lovely hotel. Perfectly placed in the middle of the canal, we found the staff to be helpful without being intrusive. Breakfast was ample and presented with lovely linens and china. Bruna made sure that each guest was welcomed and totally cared for each morning. We had a view of the marketplace across the canal and a lovely Venetian restaurant within a few steps of the hotel. Evening turndown included a cloth on the floor next of each bedside. We were welcomed with a chocolate and fruit plate as well as a personalized note. Additionally, it was very special to find this hotel listed as one of the Secrets of Venice, in the book of the same name. We celebrated our 42nd wedding anniversary here and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Master_Doubtfire
Reviews.Content: I'm actually quite shocked this hotel has managed to land 5 stars. It's a three at best. The food in the hotel restaurant is below average and very expensive. I'm surprised this hotel has so many positive reviews, because it really has nothing going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Mog321
Reviews.Content: With the hotel being only a short walk from the Rialto...but far enough away to be able to relax without the hustle of the main tourists it was everything we had hoped for. Staff were really friendly, hotel room was of the highest standard. All in all would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel we have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing hotel. Our room was spectacular and looked right out onto the canal. The daily breakfast was delicious -- love those chocolate croissants! The hotel is historical as well as functional and is in excellent condition. It was a palace and the location was away from the noise of the Rialto and St. Mark's area. From our window, we would watch the comings and goings of the fishmarket which was across the canal. There was a vaporretto stop right next door. The on site restaurant was wonderful as well.
