The staff was so helpful with restaurant recommendations, etc. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough -- it's a splurge but have your travel agent look for prepaid deals which brings the price down significantly (and then buy travel insurance which is less expensive than I imagined) . Have your own Venetian palace for a little while!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: RichardCornwallUK
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for a birthday weekend away, it lived up 100 % to expectations and fully deserves its 5 star rating. Partcular thanks to the porter and ladies on the front desk who provided unsurpassed service levels. Perfect location , great breakfast and on the Grand Canal it is somewhere I would strongly recommend

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel and experience we had in Italy”
Reviews.Author: 3badboysAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice, at the end of trip that included Rome, Spoletto, and Florence. Our travel planner initally selected a bed and breakfast for us, but we wanted the experience of a palazzo, and she chose Ca' Sagredo. It was exceptionally expensive because we had two rooms, but worth every penny. It is in a quiet location on the Grand Canal. We had a waterfront room, directly across from the fish market, while our boys' room faced the street. Our room was extremely large and well appointed. The breakfast area was off a large ballroom and had many selections. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant, preferring to sample those along our walking path. The hotel has its own dock for private transfers and there is a vapperetto directly next to it. The water taxi stop is located only a few blocks away. The hotel itself is remarkable, particularly the architecture and painting. It would be a lovely place for a special holiday. While much of this was lost on my teenagers, whose main delight was that they could get ESPN in English on the TV, it was the highlight of my trip to Italy. If you are looking for something inexpensive, there are many other choices. But if you want something special, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Although expensive, probably the best value for luxury waterfront”
Reviews.Author: mwbush80
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a few nights last New Years. I agree with the last reviewer about feeling like James Bond. I felt like James Bond most of the time I stayed at the hotel, except when I wore jeans and sneakers out at night and had to slip past the hotel guests who were enjoying the formal NYE celebration. First and foremost, the hotel is beautiful. It is so old, yet lovingly restored that it just makes you happy to be there. The frescos and large format paintings that line the walls and adorn the ceilings are truly breathtaking. It's like the hotel is built out of 18th century masterpieces. The hotel staff was most helpful. They organized a last minute Secret Itineraries tour through the Palazzo Ducale for us. They gave us really concise directions through the city, and they even had a complimentary tour of the Rialto Market with the hotel's chef. The daily breakfast was delicious and included in the price. The price was the highest I have ever paid for a hotel room, but our room was on the Grand Canal and had views all the way to Piazza San Marco. I did my homework before spending so much money on a hotel room and was confident that I would have paid almost twice as much for a similar room in one of the more notable luxury hotels. I also doubt that staying at one of the other luxury hotels would have resulted in such a romantic stay. As such, I feel like Ca Sagredo is a tremendous value for ultra high end luxury. I recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to splurge yet feel like you are getting the best deal in Venice. Also, the hotel had the most beautiful glass fixtures and glass items for sale that we saw in all of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Palazzo experience”
Reviews.Author: Buster2004
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Venice for her 40th birthday, and from the moment we stepped on the taxi-boat from the airport, feeling like James Bond, we had a wonderful time. The water-taxi arrived at the Ca'Sagredo's own jetty, and entered the beautiful interior of the hotel. We were given the room on the first floor at the top of the stairs (with a window in the wall!). Beautiful room with separate sitting area where the hotel had placed the flowers and champagne I had ordered for my wife. Bathroom was huge and very well appointed. We ate out on the first evening, but ate in the hotel restaurant on the Saturday night - the food was a very high standard (although I could have done with more!) and the service was excellent. Breakfast on both mornings was in a lovely old room on an upper floor, and was plentiful and high quality. The hotel arranged out water-taxi to the airport, stored our luggage on the final day, and in fact could not have been more helpful. It is in a fabulous position on the grand canal, a great base for exploring all parts of the City on foot or in conjunction with the river boats/gondolas. Overall, a fabulous weekend, not a cheap option by any means, but extremely memorable for a very special occasion. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Venice location”
Reviews.Author: justaroadie
Reviews.Content: November is traditionally rainy in Venice, but we were very lucky with the weather. The hotel in Venice (Ca Sagredo) was really great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room we had was quite large with a partial water view, dressing room/closet and a big bathroom. Breakfast was included in our booking and it was lovely. The hotel was on the water and right on a main walking street not far from the Rialto bridge. It was also convenient for one of the water taxi stops. If you go to Venice, I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: divabohemia
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay, the stuff was incredibly friendly and location was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: MaryandGiovanni
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in November to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and Ca' Sagredo exceeded our expectations. We have a small hotel ourselves so we know a thing or two about the business. The building is fantastic, a gem, and staff are really courteous, polite but not too stuffy. We had dinner at the restaurant the first night and the food was delicious and the service impeccable. The chef came to greet us which is a nice touch in these times of impersonal service. The whole hotel was very clean with a very good chambermaid service (clean towels twice a day). I am always very grumpy in the morning but the lively and happy waitress who served us breakfast in the morning "infecrted" me with her good humour! Thank you. We had a room on the Grand Canal and the vaporetto stop just outside our window was a very romantic lullaby, not certainly a disturbing noise.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: mdd37
Reviews.Content: Ca' Sagredo hotel exceeded our expectations. A stunning building , very friendly and helpful staff and exceptional standards of housekeeping all helped to make this a memorable holiday base. A quiet location next to the grand canal but very convenient for sightseeing and restaurants. Being english we would request tea making facilities next time we visit! We look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “bellissimo”
Reviews.Author: HG188
Reviews.Content: I travel often and for me, this is certainly is one of the finest hotels in the world. I visited Venice and stayed here for a few days with my parents. From the moment we arrived a warm welcom ..until our 5 am departure .. with cappuccinos in hand .. the staff was fantastic! A beautiful property, this gracious and comfortable 16th century palace, tastefully renovated was a marvelous experience. Wonderful large rooms, a spectacular view from some .. quiet and immaculate. I will never stay anyplace else in Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a baby palazzo on the Grand Canal - our new favourite”
Reviews.Author: Fiordiligi_10
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Venice for over 20 years and have stayed everywhere from the Gritti to the latest modern boutique B&B but in Ca'Sagredo, which was recommended to us by friends who are Venetian regulars, we have found the perfect hotel for our visits to Venice. The hotel is a little pink palace on the Grand Canal. It has only 42 rooms (small by Venetian standards) and not only is it beautifully decorated but it contains some astonishing painted ceilings by renowned artists such as Tiepolo and other original art works. The ballroom is breathtaking. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms gorgeous and the beds divinely comfortable. If you want a very special stay in Venice then this is the place for you. Prices are very good for such quality in a very expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: eklektra
Reviews.Content: It was my second trip to Venice and this time we opted to stay away from San Marco Square. We decided on the Ca Sagredo and were very happy with our choice. It is a 15 minute walk to San Marco or a few picturesque vaporetto stops away. Breakfast was good and the staff was friendly and accommodating. Don't look for pancakes and waffles or anything heavy that we like here, but there is plenty to fill you up. We got a bit confused navigating around the hotel. It's not that big there are just a few different ways to get around, but we laughed at every wrong turn. The place is easy to find. Take the vaporetto to Ca D'oro, walk down the alley, turn right, walk to the first small square where the charming gentleman is painting and it is the last door on the right or glide up in a taxi water taxi. There are a number of restaurants nearby in all price ranges. We enjoyed Vini da Gigio (sp?) and could resist posing in front of McDonalds. First timers may want to stay closer to the action. If that is not important to you I definitely recommend it. Pros: - location - decor - very friendly staff -close to vaporetto stop cons: - location - not as close to San Marco square as other hotels. If that is important than you may not enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly disappointed and certainly not 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: happyvespagirl
Reviews.Content: Terribly overpriced. This is more of a 3 star hotel with 2 star service. Not worth it period. If you like rude service and being robbed then stay here. First the room we were given was not what we paid for (was to be a junior premier suite) priced at over $500. we were given a room with a view of the AC unit ducts. and barely enough room to move around in. Ask the concierge to call a restaurant da fiore for a reservation and he tells us they are booked and recommends another up the road. well not trusting the Italian- i called myself from cell 5 min later and got a table. Ask them for timetable and how to get to airport early in am and they had no clue so at 130 am i had to run outside and look at water taxi schedule and use my internet data plan to get timetables for bus. Of course you can take a water taxi (private-their recommendation) for $100 euros but beware the concierge wanted to charge me $120-and note you will have to walk 8 min to get to airport. There are many nice hotels in venice this is not one of them and would only choose as last resort ie: all else under water. AND BTW no rooms have a view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “First time must see venice!”
Reviews.Author: peterjbben
Reviews.Content: My wife and I could be described as spoilt seasoned travellers. Venice has for a little while been on our should visit list. We chose the Ca' Sagredo as I purchased a good deal on an Auction site ,which I use, following my usual extensive investigation of the hotel we traveled for a three night stay via Easy jet. Surprising the flight was good the booked pick up by private launch all went smothly , but the meet and greet is a venice con as we were dumped with no booked water taxi by the dock! Hotel was excellent, friendly staff good service and a delightful room with all things as expected of five stars.The hotel resturant for our first Venice dinner was also an excellent choice. The hotel had booked for two other typical venice resturants for us for the follwing evenings. Both were good choices and we had a gondola to take us to the one on our last evening as it was further than we either wanted to walk having done many of the Venice sights during our stay. In short an excellent reasonable priced hotel , good service and standard of all accomadation . Special note of the beautiful breakfast and indeed the rooms it was served in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel as long as you don't have to eat or drink there!”
Reviews.Author: Moss1236
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a three night stay at Ca Sagredo. The hotel is well located and has an impressive reception/staircase to the second level. Staff service is good with everybody speaking English. Rooms are a good size and well appointed. Our major negative with the hotel is the cost of food/drink. We ate in the restaurant on the first night of stay having arrived late. It was VERY expensive for what you got. We didn't eat there again! Breakfast which in our case was included in price, was good but not if I am honest excellent. I came away from the stay not hugely disappointed, but simply thinking the hotel could do so much better.

Reviews.Title: “not suitable for any kind of stay , Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: msmq8
Reviews.Content: .we went to Venice looking for a nice hotel to spend our wedding anniversary , so i have chooses this hotel from the site ( small luxury hotel SLH ) , but when i reached the hotel it was a piece of old , dirty , worthless , bad hotel . the service was slow , with a word ( NO ) facing you where ever you are going . the room condition was very bad , see the pictures plz . it was dirty , A/C was full of dirt, the furniture is full of scratches , bath room with a bad condition. so my advice plz don't consider this hotel in your visit to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Not big on Americans”
Reviews.Author: Trippy3333
Reviews.Content: Unique place to stay. A little loud and busy with ferry back and forth to Rialto market. Hotel manager was seated at table next to me having breakfast meeting with a visiting hotelier. Ca'Sagredo manager kept railing on America and Americans. Her counterpart kept steering her away from this topic but she kept going back despite his best efforts. She had her back to me but he could clearly tell I was hearing all of this. She looks like, and could be, the woman whose picture appears on their webpage. Front desk employee confirmed she was the manager and made reference visiting hotelier as being "big time." If that's top leadership, you can guess what the rest of the employees might be like.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Accommodations and Service!”
Reviews.Author: NickyGHawaii
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at Ca'Sagredo, and the experience was amazing! The public rooms in the former palazzo are magnificent, as well as the room we booked. Having been to Venice a number of times already, we selected a suite on the court side of the building instead of the Grand Canal. The room was beautifully decorated and retained the ornamental plaster work. The bathrooms are sumptuous with marble-lined walls and high-end fixtures. I can honestly say I've never stayed in a room so quiet and dark! The windows are shuttered at night and have three layers of drapes. The two sitting rooms provided comfortable seating, as well as having three flat-screen televisions. The staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfast superbly set in some of the former salons on the piano nobile, and the bar area on the canal was a delight for drinks. I arrived at the hotel by water taxi (50 Euros) and docked at a private landing outside the lobby, but the vaporetto stop (Ca'd'Oro #1 line) is next to the hotel as well for a less expensive arrival. A traghetto stop (50 cents) is just outside the front entry to cross the canal without using one of the bridges (remember to remain standing to get the proper experience!). I'd highly recommend this treasure to anyone heading to Venice! Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Start to our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Wannderer
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this place because of its history and art as my wife appreciates both. I couldnt take my eyes off the photographs on their website while booking and the hotel was exactly like in the photographs. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the welcome very warm. The rooms were well presented with the lamps and furniture. The bathrooms were awesome. The breakfast was in halls with paintings and frescos giving the feeling have having a royal meal. The restaurant is a little expensive though. We had 2 'single' beds on our cot which was irritant but we didnt complain as just one of them was large enough for us to sleep. The location is very nice and close to one of the mini-marts there. 10-15 min walk to both Rialto and the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wrexham83
Reviews.Content: Expensive.It would have been nice if there was a coffee maker in the room.No ironing boards allowed in the room.A steamer for clothing would have been helpful.Expensive for drinks and dinner.Hence,there was alack of atmosphere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Venice hotel for the more refined guest”
Reviews.Author: lacosteman
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel . It does not seem overwhelming , but you discover more and more that it is a wonderful place . A converted 18th cent home , beautiful fresco's adorn the ballroom walls . It is very central in Venice and an ideal base to explore the city . It is just a few minutes from the ferry stop , situated on the main canal .

Reviews.Title: “Very warm welcome fabulous location and service”
Reviews.Author: NDPri
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights at August end - we got very good price for the room for last minute booking...we were celebrating our husband's birthday and they upgraded us to a superior room...amazing room...nd the best part was the housekeeping service...every time we went out (even for brkfast) they came and cleaned our room...enjoyed staying thr would recommend very much...only issue was that the bed were two twins joined - the manager said its probably a feature of Venice or moreso Italy though we got a double bed in other Italian hotels...

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Default111111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on the first part of our honeymoon. Lovely hotel in wonderful surroundings. Rooms were not as nice as we had expected from photos, though still nice. Chambermaids were fantastic. Reception staff ok, breakfast, bar and restaurant staff mixed. Going from very friendly to nonchalant. Price of internet in room was astonishing at 10 euros per hour, as were the drinks in the bar (but not unusual for 5 star in Vencie). Waterbus stop very close. The hotel is a little out of the busier areas but still close enough to walk to the Rialto bridge and St Mark's Square. Breakfast had a good selection. We had dinner once. The food was mixed. My steak was lovely, but my wife's was standard. Sitting on the terrace over the Grand Canal was sensational though. Overall, a very happy and satisfied stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best and away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: casamoir
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old school luxury but with a modern attitude. At check-in, they took the time to explain the surrounding area and things to do, like visit the fish market across the grand canal. The room was just stunning. Sometimes when you stay for a while even in a 5 star hotel, you sometimes don't get toiletries replaced etc. or the room may not appear as it was on day 1. This wasn't the case here. It was just lovely to come home to this hotel every day. I was supposed to stay for 3 nights and extended for an extra 2 nights. One of the highlights for me, was that the staff were really down to earth. It's also away from the crowds in Venice and easy walking distance to some really low key local neighborhoods with excellent restaurants. I cannot wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly luxurious, with an atmosphere of history”
Reviews.Author: provi
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite overlooking the canal. My only criticism is that in the enormous suite there was only one telephone. The staff were extremely helpful, there is a vaporetto stop just outside for the number 1 vaporetto which takes you to most places and the hotel is conveniently situated to walk everywhere. Not cheap but wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “When will they learn you feel ripped off?”
Reviews.Author: jcmadrid
Reviews.Content: Just finished our stay at this hotel... Two days in what is of course one of the most wonderful cities in the world. But my memories of the Ca Sagredo are not the impecable service, or the friendly, helpful reception staff, or the fantastic setting in a medieval italian "palazzo" or the idyllic location overlooking the grand canal. Nor will I remember the wonderfull breakfast next to the main ballroom listening to Vivaldi and Chopin as we had breakfast, nor the restaurant right on the canal. No, what I will remember of the Ca Sagredo is the INSULT of being charged TEN EUROS PER HOUR for an internet connection after spending 400 Euros per night for a suite with a canal view. Basically, you feel cheated and insulted when a hotel charges you that amount of money for a room, and then rips you off for an internet connection. DonÂ´t they realise how badly it reflects on them? When I go back to Venice in a couple of months I wonÂ´t stay there again, so thatÂ´s 800 Euros theyÂ´ll lose. Have they really made that much from net connections to afford to p*** people of to that extent? The curious thing is that I really donÂ´t mind paying 400 Euros a night for a room. But I DO mind being treated like an idiot, which is what theyÂ´re doing. PS: "Venice Connect" works fine from the hotel room and costs a small fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful of hotels...”
Reviews.Author: Queensgirl55
Reviews.Content: I couldn't think of a more beautiful, refined hotel in which to celebrate our thirtieth wedding anniversary. This gem of a hotel exudes a quiet elegance amid an historical setting. The palazzo is original to the 17th century, and the guest rooms have access to the magnificent original fresco-painted rooms in the historic part of this palazzo. We were awed by the beauty of these rooms. I can only equate it to being allowed to stay in the Uffizi galleries as your own personal hotel. We were treated with courtesy and deference by the staff, and the elegance of service does justice to the elegance of the setting. We had a magnificent view of the canal from our room. I would just like to mention the little extra touches that stood out for us: When I mentioned this was our anniversary, a bottle of champagne and chocolates awaited us with a personal letter of congratulations. You will be happy you chose this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DavidIL
Reviews.Content: My wife checked out of the hotel yesterday morning. She was miserable there. First, the hotel failed to side with her when a water taxi overcharged her by 100% (50+ euros for a 5 minute ride from the train station -- the guide book warned her about this trick and she knew it was a false fee, but the hotel essentially sided with the driver of the water taxi though this was clearly wrong). Second, her passport was later stolen while she was walking in Venice. The hotel staff were unhelpful and even hostile when she begged them for advice. She described to me that though she was in tears, they were essentially indifferent to her problems (she needed advice about getting a new passport and about reporting the crime). This is completely unacceptable for a hotel that claims to merit 5 stars. They made a bad situation worse. (There was also a problem with the air-conditioning -- either too hot or too cold.)

Reviews.Title: “"paradise found"”
Reviews.Author: debbiegj
Reviews.Content: What can I say! You cetainly get what you pay for with this lovely hotel. Lovely Boutique hotel with everything you could have wished for - stunning room with view of the grand canal from the window and very luxurious and romantic settling. It had such a lovely italian feel to the hotel, beautiful champagne breakfast and goreous food and cocktails - with the luxury of being on the grand canal. I went here with my husband - but will be back with our 2 children next time- definately go again - thankyou so much.

Reviews.Title: “cosy place centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Supratikban
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, comfortable and spacious but ask for front side rooms or you will be looking over the roofs at nothing in particular or into a wall. One problem with the room was that it promotes using internet through their TV as there is no place to park your laptop if you intend using your own laptop - you have no option but to sit on the floor as the cabinet-top doesnt have space to work. Food was good although a lot of things listed on the menu were not available. Staff were pleasant but could be warmer. Pretty decent hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience right on the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: RalphSchmitt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at Ca' Sagredo prior to cruising to Athens. The hotel was outstanding in every way. Our lovely room was on the 2nd floor with 2 windows overlooking the Canal. All staff members were warm, friendly, helpful. This small, boutique hotel is a converted palace that retains many of its regal, stunning features. We had dinner one evening in the hotel's intimate L'Alcova restaurant, which we recommend highly. We also had cocktails/Prosecco several times on the terrace outside the restaurant on the Canal - a perfect spot to watch all the water activiity, especially at night. We had an excellent buffet breakfast each morning in beautiful rooms with charming staff. Location in excellent, within easy walking distance of everything. There is a vaporetto (water bus) stop next to the hotel and a tragetto location (gondola to cross the canal) on the other side of the hotel. And gondolas are right there, as well. We arrived and departed the hotel by water taxi, right at the hotel's own dock, which was extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Venice........”
Reviews.Author: FloHants
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel worthy of all its stars. Our room was elegantly furnished and extremely comfortable and we had an excellent view of the Grand Canal. Although in a central location it seemed very quiet. The staff were efficient and always helpful, even down to posting a card! An excellent breakfast was included in our deal and was taken in one of the state rooms of this 16th century palace. Food and drinks in the hotel were expensive but then so is everything in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: NYC1952
Reviews.Content: This beautiful restored palazzo is perfectly located. The property lives up to any expectation of what a fine Venetian hotel should be. The room was well furnished, spacious, comfortable, and clean. A delicious breakfast is served in what must have been a ballroom. Room service, front desk, were tops. What I do caution, is the notion of a room with a view. We upgraded to a room with a partial view of the Grand Canal. It all depends on your definition of the word partial, but I would say we had no view. It wasn't worth the additional cost. So my advice is if you could give up the expectation of a view, this hotel is great. What you get for the upgrade just isn't worth it, and winds up undermining what is otherwise a pretty great experience, and well worth it overall.

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny050110
Reviews.Content: This place was idelaly located off the Ca' Doro vaporetto stop and if you walk out you are directly at a gondola/traghetto station. We stayed there for our honeymoon and it was wonderful. They upgraded us to a suite with a full view of the Grand Canal and to rebut some other reviews I have read on this property, were not stuffy at all. I have travelled extensively in some of the nicest hotels in the world, and I truly think this is one of the best. Beware the urge to eat Pringles out of the mini bar however, 7 euros a pop! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic five star palace”
Reviews.Author: 60stravellingcouple
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise stay for my wife, and she absolutely loved it! We were allocated a spacious first floor room, with very comfortable large double bed and a seating area with a window overlooking the Campo and Canal Grande. Superb room, large bathroom with powershower, lots of fluffy towels, dressing gown and slippers. Received a bottle of champagne with chocolates. Beautiful Murano glass chandeliers, walls were decorated with silk. Staff very helpfull and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Beatifully decorated hotel. Great breakfast, including selections of bread, cold meat, hot food, fruuit juices and champagne. Restaurant staff very friendly and helpful. Next to main shopping street and close to Rialto etc. Charges in restaurants are higher than in Rome were we travelled from by Eurostar. But don't take a water taxi! For a five minute ride to the station we were charged 50 Euro! Next time take the water bus for 12 Euro for two. At certain times, the hotel offers special rates, three nights for the price of two plus an upgrade. There are warnings that Venice gets flooded between November and April, be aware! But they put in walk ways when required.

Reviews.Title: “A palace home very well placed”
Reviews.Author: janiceLisbon
Reviews.Content: Venice is full of palaces and CaÂ´Sagredo looks out side as a beautiful one with light rose walls and beautiful windows looking trough the grand canal. Rooms are all different and nice. Furniture and decoration with good taste, some luxe but very cobnfortable. The staff are nice but not enthusiasitc. The best of Ca' sagredo is location. Very well place, very central not to far not to close.. A vaporetto station ( Ca' d' oro just in lateral facade building helps a lot to travel easily for every where). The Rialto market ( beautiful) is just in face to the hotel and the trajjectto is just there too. the terrace is great to have a nice spritz or bellini. The prices of drinks and food are aexpensive. If you have to pay the breakfast is too expensive but you have lots of nice options the most close you imagine. The architecture and Venice lives there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: jandrews
Reviews.Content: The Ca Sagredo is a beautifully restored hotel that is off the beat and path so it's great for walking without the masses. We stayed in the Sebastiano Ricci suite and it was huge and really lovely. It is one very large room with frescoed ceilings and a large seating area. The bathroom is nice sized and updated. The floors slope a lot so the bed is on a platform to keep it level. The housekeeping is very on top of things and the people at the desk are very nice. The breakfast was incredible- lots of things to pick from and all were really good. It is a quiet hotel, not much going on in the lobby which was fine with us. Everyone was very nice and friendly and I enjoyed the stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoDiSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our 12 day honeymoon. We had just stayed at some of the best hotels in Italy, so staying here was fine but not overwhelmingly nice. It is well located in Venice along one of the many canals. The staff is pretty helpful. We were disappointed by the gym since the exercise machines were not working during our stay so we couldn't work out. The rooms were small but well decorated and fine. The breakfast is very nice and it is in one of the lower floor ballrooms, which are spectacular to walk through (this is the best thing about this hotel). Worth staying at but i am not sure it is worth the $500 per night we paid.

Reviews.Title: “expected a good deal more”
Reviews.Author: mathildexl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at room # 311, called "Water View Double Prestige Room". In reality you have to tiptoe to catch a side glimpse of the Canale Grande. The best part is the terrace in front of the hotel at the Grand Canal. The magnificent common room as shown in their brochure is almost empty and hardly a place to meet fellow travellers. The breakfast isnÂ´t adequate for Cinque Stelle Lusso. Cheap Hotdog type sausages and Salami of a similar quality, tasteless cow milk milk Mozzarella and so forth. The staff is friendly and efficient with one exception: We left the hotel to go by public transport (Vaporetto) to the train station. After 20 minutes we were told that they were on strike! Nobody at the Hotel cared to tell us these facts.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning palace away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Globbo
Reviews.Content: I don't give this hotel five stars in every category lightly - the Ca' Sagredo really could not have been better. I ended up loving the location a little north of the Rialto, because it was away from the throngs clogging San Marco. If you travel to Venice during high season, the Ca' Sagredo gets you away from the crowds but still puts you within easy striking distance of all the major sights. As an added bonus, there's a traghetto right outside the front door of the hotel to take you across the Grand Canal (a deal for only 50 cents per person) . We stayed in a standard room facing the campo, which turned out to be more like a junior suite. It had a sitting area with a love seat and a very pleasant bath. But the Library Suite, where the rest of our party stayed, was fantastically gorgeous. This suite is the original library of the palace, and it's a soaring two stories tall, with ornate gold bookcases and a huge Murano chandelier. The furniture is a lovely mix of antiques and replicas, and there's a small balcony with a stunning view of the Grand Canal. This suite isn't for everyone though; there is a guest toilet on the first level, but it's 20 steps up to the master bathroom with the shower and tub. That aside, it's a simply incredible accommodation. Public areas of the hotel were equally magnificent; most of the palace's original frescoes and stucco work are in place. It's a magical environment - I felt like I was staying in my own private Venetian palace. We also enjoyed the terrace fronting the Grand Canal - it's a great place to relax and have a cocktail. This is my new favorite hotel in Venice. I think the value for the money that you get at the Ca' Sagredo can't be beat anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and location for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorldx2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Venice and found this hotel to be excellent. The rooms are newly renovated and spacious. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The location is perfect. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HamishandMeg
Reviews.Content: Excellent location from which to explore Venice. Beautiful, clean, luxurious hotel. Wouldn't consider staying anywhere else if we return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCarters
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. If you have any sense of history and romance you can't fail but be blown away by it's grandeur. It is a former Doges' palace and apparantly took 5 years to renovate. They have been dogged by red tape and because it is obviously a listed building some of the projects they would like to do will take time. You really feel that you are staying in a palace. The public rooms are very grand, I have never had my breakfast in a room with frescos on the wall! Our bedroom was lovely. It was a urban panoramic view and we had a view of the little square outside. If you want to see the Grand canal then you can sit on the terrace or go to the beautiful balcony in the huge ballroom. We had a meal in the restaurant whilst there which was expensive yes but hey you are on holiday and you are supposed to treat yourself! The meal was delicious and in beautiful surroundings. We thought that all of the staff were very efficient, helpful and friendly.It is very convienient for the vapporetto bus and the tranchetti to cross the canal is just outside. Venice is a walking city and the hotel is wonderfully placed to stroll along the narrow streets there is far more to see than just St Marks' Square. It may be 50 Euros for a water taxi to St Marks but a 3 day vapporetto bus pass only cost 33 Euros and that includes going over to all the islands. We went to the Ghetto area which was very interesting and over to Murano and Burano Islands We would not hesitate to reccomend this hotel and I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: sandiegoguy
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous reviewers --- liked this hotel, but didn't love it. Standard room very pleasant, clean, large enough to be comfortable, great view over the grand canal. Staff friendly and helpful. Close by Ca D'oro vaporetto stop. Downsides: public rooms a little run down; computer access limited; breakfast nice but not great. Next time we would stay closer to the Rialto Bridge. As an aside, we were consistently disappointed with restaurant food in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, but didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: Bebe38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here, in a suite. We were travelling on a luxury link package, incredible value, but the hotel puts their full price clients first. We first were given a oddly shaped room with tiny dormer windows on the 4th floor, really not acceptable. They agreed to change us to a nicer room, although it was just a room, and our package was for a suite. No welcome note, no prosecco, etc. So, luxury link people - beware. I just wasn't in the mood to press further. The room was lovely, good a/c, acceptable breakfast. No bathrobes or slippers, and few amenities. A fee for Wifi. The location is quite out of the way, up the Grand Canal past the Rialto Bridge. A private water taxi is 50 Euros to St mark's plaza, to give you an idea. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant, finding the food very good and the atmosphere charming. Overall the service is friendly and warm, although one front desk woman was useless - gave us wrong directions, was no help in finding a tailor, and had zero knowledge of the Venice Biannale, the popular exposition currently throughout the city. Don't count on this hotel if you need serious concierge service. Overall, we would stay here again, giving it 4 stars, but we didn't fall in love with Ca Sagredo.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but not the great hotel i expected”
Reviews.Author: WestCountryNorthy
Reviews.Content: Would have to agree with the last review on quite a few things,We had really high expectations of this hotel from previous Tripadvisor comments and photos but our first impressions did not live up to these. . We had to wait 2 hours to check in. As we arrived around noon and check in was not untill 2pm. We were also told that the only place we could freshen up was in the two toilet cubicles next to the bar and as previously said served all the public rooms in the hotel. We also were not treated to a guided tour or any explanation of the hotel services ,We didn't recieve any welcoming gift , not even chocolates like the review before did. We had booked a Double room with a panoramic urban view, this was a little disappointing, there was no view as the room(402) was on the top floor and didn't have a window, it had a outside space but all you could see from it was the rooftops of the surrounding hotels and that was only if you were 6ft tall or above.. The room was beautifully decorated but we were very disappointed that it was quite small, the bathroom on the other hand was massive which was a very strange layout, i personally would have prefered a bigger room and smaller bathroom. The reception didn't have a information desk for trips,guides and events etc which would have been helpful as at the end of our stay we found a leaflet for venice guided tours , something which we would liked to have done. The hotel was very grand, everything was decorated tastefully and you really felt like you were in a palace. The location is also great - far enough away from the excesses of St Marco, but still in the real Venice. Lots of small cafes and shops are around the hotel,Also being next door to the Vaparetto stop means that getting to/from the hotel is easy for sightseeing. Overall it was a very nice hotel, i somehow got a feeling though that as soon as the hotel knew i had booked with expedia we were given one of the worse rooms as our room didn't look like any of the official hotel photos. Venice though was magnificent, very busy during this time of year but beautifull views and great to explore around. My girlfriend and I got engaged on the trip which really topped off a lovely trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions didnâ€™t do this hoteljustice”
Reviews.Author: top-trippers
Reviews.Content: We had really high expectations of this hotel from previous Tripadvisor comments and photos but our first impressions did not live up to these. This was especially disappointing given that my husband had contacted the hotel in advance to make various special requests to celebrate my birthday. We had to wait nearly 15 minutes to check in. As we arrived around noon our room was not yet ready which we had planned for so had a change of clothes in our hand luggage. However we were told that the only place we could freshen up was in the two toilet cubicles next to the bar/restaurant one of which was occupied. As these toilets served all the public rooms in the hotel we felt obliged to rush.. Unlike some other guests we were not treated to a guided tour or any explanation of the hotel services (the lady from reception who showed us to our room advised that she was just finishing for the day). There was no hotel guide in the room so we had to go back to reception to ask where brteafast was served and at what time etc. Unlike other (lower star) hotels we stayed at during this trip there was no welcoming bottle of Prosecco - although the chocolate covered strawberries and cherries were gorgeous. We had booked a junior suite with front canal view. The room (304) was beautifully decorated but we were very disappointed that the sitting area was split from the bed room by the bathroom. Some people might have thought it cosy but it was a bit claustrophobic for us and so we did not use. The bathroom had no separate shower (mainly because it was too small). There was only one narrow window (no foot balcony) opening onto the canal. If we had known all this in advance we would not have upgraded our room. We had made advance reservations for a quiet and romantic table in the downstairs restaurant for both nights of our stay however when we arrived at the restaurant we were told that there was no reservation. We were given a table and whilst the food and service was good by this time we were so disappointed that we decided to eat somewhere else the following night. On the second day things started to look up. We found the breakfast room on the first floor â€“ WOW. The breakfast was pretty good too. Through the hotel my husband had pre-arranged the â€˜Secret Tourâ€™ of the Doges Palace (which I would highly recommend) and a gondola ride. On our last day (my actual birthday) my husband surprised me with a celebratory lunch at the roof top restaurant at the Danieli - somewhere he knew I have always wanted to stay. The views were fabulous and we both agreed that the lunch was one of the best meals we have ever had. This was a brilliant note to end on â€“ I didnâ€™t want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “really worth it”
Reviews.Author: costamendes
Reviews.Content: we went to Venice as a 10th wedding anniversary trip. I tried to pick one hotel which was romantic, historical, cool, fashionable and well-located. I did the right choice when I picked up Ca' Sagredo. Its location outside San Marco neibourhood was superb, once we could easily get there by foot while profiting to wander through the magnificent Venice narrow streets and channels on our way. Besides, we were completely out of the touristic crowds. Now, the hotel is a historic treasure on its own, truly unique. The meal at the hotel's "L'alcova" restaurant (although a very small restaurant with only five tables) was also first class - in fact, one of Venice best kept secrets. Our room was spacious, with a a sofa and coffee table and a marbled bathroom with little windows overlooking the Venices roofings (which is also a very nice sight). On the day we arrived, there were these absolutely DELICIOUS strawberries dipped in dark chocolate waiting for us in the room!!. On a more negative note, as we always took some time to rest a little bit before dinner (late dinner) there were some days that the maids did not open our beds for the night. Besides that, one could have expected breakfast to have ingredients of a better superior quality, but overall it was not that bad. It is not a cheap hotel, but then again elegance does not come cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rpvtraveler10
Reviews.Content: The ambiance, art, food, location and service were worth every Euro. Memories that last forever.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous decor mixed with flawless service”
Reviews.Author: VeroneseParis
Reviews.Content: Ca' Sagredo surpassed every notion I had of excellent service and refined decoration. The rooms are exquisitely decorated without being too ornate, the perfect balance of antique furniture without and simplicity that one appreciates when travelling for work. The friendly and multi-lingual staff are is rare to find in European cities. The reason for our trip was to visit the Biennale, and the hotel offered the perfect haven of peace after bieng in crowded exhibits all day. The breakfast, served in a series of opulent rooms with frescoed ceilings, was nothing less than delightful, and the iced tea served daily in the main hall with its magnificent view over the canal only added to the charm of the hotel. Also perfect also for a romantic vacation or a honeymoon, this hotel leaves nothing to be desired!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miasig
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, with very nice Junior Suites. Laura at Front Desk was always helpful with good tips and recommendations. The hotel is a good15-20 minute walk from San Marco Plaza which is only downside but hotel is right near some fine little coffee, bakery and gelato shops. I would suggest airport water taxi direct to hotel, skip the hassle of taking water bus although it is right next to hotel for up and down day visits.

Reviews.Title: “A Once In A Lifetime Experience”
Reviews.Author: KetteringHarvey
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I Stayed here for 4 nights and had a fabulous time. Our room was lovely and the staff were friendly and very helpful. Many thanks to Laura for sorting out the problem we had with a purchase we overpaid for!!! Gary & Pat Kettering Northants AND THE STAFF WERE VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFULL. MANY THANKS TO LAURA WHO SORTED OUT A MAJOR PROBLEM WE HAD OVER A GIFT WE OVERPAID FOR. GARY & PAT KETTERING NORTHANTS.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita”
Reviews.Author: LivinLaDolceVita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly spectacular. My wife and I have been lucky enough to stay in many, many top-flight hotels in many, many places. Ca' Sagredo is a unique, sublime experience. The entire stay, from the moment we arrived via water taxi, to our immense (and quiet) 2nd floor suite, to the impeccable service, to our reluctant departure, was one we relished. Words really can't describe the palazzo itself and the 17th/18th century art that surrounds you. Smokers beware: you can't smoke in the building because of the presence of so many great works of art (we were grateful). And the location is absolutely perfect, although the Ca' D'Oro vaporetto stop in front could be a problem if you're a light sleeper, but do yourself a favor: stay here anyway, just bring earplugs. It's that good. On a different note, the dinner we had in the restaurant here was the best we had in Venezia. The food was absolutely electric and inspired, prepared and presented perfectly. Even if we weren't staying here, we'd go to this restaurant. Truly an astonishing meal. If I were to be critical of anything, and it's a minor criticism, the wine list is neither broad nor deep. It's understandable, as they don't seem to be doing anything to promote the restaurant independently, and perfectly acceptable, as there appeared to be many reasonable wine choices (including the Valpolicella we had). They really should make an effort to promote the food there, as it was astonishingly good. A special note of thanks to Roberto for making us feel warmly welcome -- and feeding us Aperol and Campari Spritz!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Luxury”
Reviews.Author: AusSXSW
Reviews.Content: You stay in a perfectly preserved Venetian Palace...it's that simple. When we showed people our pictures of the hotel, everyone thought it was from a historical building we were visiting in Venice. It's opulent, the service is great, the rooms are incredible and you eat breakfast under 500 year old hand painted frescoes. I've never stayed in any hotel in any city quite like it.

Reviews.Title: “I felt as if I were a 15th Century princess in the Ca Sagredo Palace.”
Reviews.Author: travmam
Reviews.Content: After waiting many years to visit Venice for the first time, I found myself spoiled forever by the palatial luxury and attentive staff of Ca Sagredo, overlooking the Grand Canal. The tasteful, stunning restoration of this architectural gem in a perfect location was matched by comfort, class, and excellent food. My room was just lovely--calm and dreamy--with a huge marble bath (definitely NOT 15th Century!). The staff arranged concert tickets and invited me to a lovely lace exhibit with an opportunity to meet and communicate with the lovely elderly lady responsible for this gorgeous work; I saw her at breakfast (lovely) the following day, and felt thru her I was at a home I would return to very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Got engaged”
Reviews.Author: DWAG
Reviews.Content: After a really interesting trip across to Venice we arrived at the Hotel to a very warm welcome from the reception staff. Our room was fantastic and looked over the main stairwell, (might not sound so exciting it was lovely). To be honest we spent so much time outside the hotel it was difficult to find fault in anything in the hotel. Inside and outside it was stunning. Breakfast was more than adequate and the service excellent. Only complaint would be was that I explained that my partner and I were getting engaged when we arrived and it would have been a nice to see that recognised. I would return again tomorrow, maybe not to the same hotel as it was not memorable but to the city as it was! Finally - take plenty of cash , keep it secure and be careful with your credit cards as I had ours cloned. It really put a dampner on our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CHARPOL
Reviews.Content: Very good location ,, however just above the vaporetto stop which works the whole night so not easy to sleep; awful wet smell in lobby and sitting rooms ; no orange juice for breakfast ( not arrived at 7.30,, no more at 8.30!!! ; employees very cold without any smile when they were there. Definitely will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “It was simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: straysheeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night. The lobby beautifully decorated. Our room was just perfect! Their service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, a real gem - close to the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bennwin
Reviews.Content: My family were taking a cruise from Venice so we needed a nice hotel that would accommodate the children and would have easy access. The Ca'Sagredo fitted the bill perfectly: they were great with the family and the easy location near the Ca' D'Oro vaporetto stop was good. It was an easy walk to the Ponte Rialto and St Marks Square. It was the start of the "Acqua Alta" while we were there and the hotel is sited that bit higher, so we had no problems, even though St. Marks was flooded out. The hotel itself was lovely. It is a real Palazzio, with a grand hall and main staircase. We had two rooms, one with a near 360 deg view over the canal and the city from its terrace; our other room was the Library Suite, which was unique and very romantic, with its small balcony looking right over the Grand Canal. Apart from the Ca' D'Oro itself, there is a Traghetto right next to the hotel which takes you right over to the market near the Rialto Bridge. Lovely overall - a beautiful gem in the heart of the romantic city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - Best ever”
Reviews.Author: lizardman1
Reviews.Content: Walking through the door was an experience in itself. The reception hall opened up in front of us and exuded luxury. The staff were fantastic and very helpful and polite. We were shown to our suite which was beautiful on the first floor and with a view over the Grand Canal. It was equipped with everything you would need with tv's in the lounge, the bedroom and the bathroom. I would recommend wiling away on couple of hours on the verandah overlooking the canal and watching the world go by with a coffee or two! The history in the hotel was just superb and the route to breakfast was just stunning. Overall a lovely experience for our 6th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: suitecasepacked
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break at the hotel ca sagredo, in celebration of my fourtieth. The hotel itself is a completely and wonderfully restored 15th centuary palace, and all of the hotel has retained its palatial feel and character, our room was comfortable and beautifully decorated, the bathroom was a real retreat with hot water and fancy toilettrees in abundance, however sadly I must agree with quite a few of the other reviews in that it lacked any real atmosphere and warmth. There was no bar or snug areas where you could relax and have a chat with other quests or simple take in the wonderful views that this hotel has to offer being directly on the grand canal, the staff however were very polite and helpful, we had breakfast included in our stay, but also found this not upto 5 star hotels that we have previously stayed in, also the room it was served in although beautiful lacked any atmosphere you felt that you almost wanted to whisper incase you disturbed the ghosts, i mean guests!!! Anyway in saying that ,the hotel is ideally situated being very convienent for all the attractions of st marks and rialdo bridge area, there are some great eateries and bars just a simple stroll from the hotel which are not as pricey as some you may find nearer to st marks, try out "la cantina" a great wine bar that not only has a good selection of wines and a few good beers but also serves some great food home made soups and fab paninis. also near by is a great local italian restaurant called "Vini da Gigio" i took the recommendation from another review and didnot regret it, but book early as it gets very busy. Venice was amazing and we had an amazing time, if we were ever to return we would probably stay in the area but not necessarily at the ca sagredo. Also just have to stay that the transport system must be one of the most easiest and effiecient I have ever experienced, Ken obviously didn't visit Venice when he was in office as london mayor!!!!

Reviews.Title: “La Serenissima at its best”
Reviews.Author: blanketbay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a magical four days in Venice staying at the Ca'Sagredo. We were celebrating 30 years of friendship and being with our small art group from London - who were staying elsewhere- poor things! I was worried that the hotel might be too grand to feel truly relaxed but the friendly and extremely efficient staff put all my worries to rest. We had room 201, a beautifully decorated room in creams and browns with great attention to detail. The buffet breakfasts were excellent, where else do you get offered Prosecco for breakfast? And as it was there we just had to try it! We experienced the aqua alter for the first time and I was extremely pleased I had packed my wellies. The rain, however was interspersed with lovely sunshine and we were able to eat outside on most days. Highlights of the trip were going to the opera at La Fenice and visiting Torcello. We have been to Venice a few times already but our stay at the Ca'Sagredo made it our best trip yet. A huge thank you to Sylvia and the front of house staff.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS CA'SAGREDO”
Reviews.Author: alexjn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled on the Orient Express to celebrate being married for a year and as an extra suprise we stayed at the Ca'Sagredo. It was stunning! The main room over looking the grand canal was beautiful by day or night. Our room was right at the top of the hotel with a balcony, from which we could see the canal, the campanile and the rialto market. The people were lovely, breakfast deicious and the cannegrio area all that we expected. A superb stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting hotel”
Reviews.Author: a30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Ca'Sagredo. From the time we arrived by private boat from the airport until the time we left by vaporetto to the rail station we were enchanted. We were greeted at the hotel dock genially and escorted to registration which was smooth. Our interior courtyard view suite was elegant and immaculate. The housekeeping staff is terrific. The floral arrangements throughout the public rooms are fragrant and beautiful and add a fresh new facet to a centuries old palace. Breakfast buffet is plentiful and varied. We ate at different times each morning and the supply of food was frequently replenished with hot items. The staff was welcoming and attentive and the room bright and cheerful. We received accurate and useful information from the front desk staff for touring Venice. Their suggestions were welcome. The management has created an atmosphere of hospitality that is usually found when guests are visiting a private home. We observed them engaging each guest as a personal friend. Ca'Sagredo is a delightful upscale Venetian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Jewel”
Reviews.Author: diannemichigan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Ca'Sagredo Hotel in Venice. This hotel is truly a "jewel". The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service. The rooms were so luxurious and beautiful I didn't want to leave. The hotel has an excellent location. It is minutes from the Rialto Bridge and 10 minutes from the square. It is located on the Grand Canal and has a private pier as well as a public pier next door. Gondola's are available as you walk out the door. The restaurant was fabulous with a view that was incredible. Overall, I would return to Venice just to stay in a room at the Ca'Sagredo. This hotel is a must stay in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “My birthday party in Ca'Sagredo”
Reviews.Author: kivavera
Reviews.Content: When I visited the hotel in March 2008 we decided with my wife to organize a party for our 40th wedding birthday due in October 2008. I have invited 5 couples for 2 days. I must say my friends and myself will keep a wonderful souvenir of our stay. The hotel by itself is a real beauty, the atmosphere give you the idea of what a true Venitian Palace was in the 15 & 16th century. Rooms are at the top. You find everything you can expect. We had the chance to celebrated our birhtday in the Music Room where we had our diner. Food and service were absolutly great. The chef Mr Cosino deserve to be rewarded by the Michelin. I recommand the "mushrooms and langoustine risotto". The visitors must address to Audrey Di Fruscia, she is very kind and helpful and speaks french fluently. The chef of the reception is Mr Lo Mastro. You could'nt find more friendly. This address was recommanded to me by someone belonging to old Venitian aristocracy and I thank the good advise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay- great service, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zoedax
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this lovely hotel. We booked a Grand Canal room and although the room was a bit on the small side the view more than made up for it! Service was excellent and very friendly. We were given great advice on dining as well as general tourist information. We were celebrating our honeymoon and they were gracious enough to send up some sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries, a very nice touch! Breakfast was more than adequate, hot and cold food items, an array of beverages, sparkling wine, etc. The opulent music and drawing rooms on the second level and the grand staircase are unlike anything I have seen at a hotel- just amazing! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL I EVER STAYED”
Reviews.Author: tdsbc
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Ca' Sagredo Hotel for three nights at the beginning of October. We had two great rooms, one facing the Grand Canal, the other facing a court yard, the red tile roofs and the bell towers of Venice. The location is unique: while situated right on the historic waterway and next to the most significant palaces in the city, the hotel does not suffer from the noise and confusion found in the San Marco area yet it is only a short walking distance (10 minutes) from the famous Square. Among other things, we really enjoyed exploring the old fish and vegetable markets located across the canal from the hotel and the kids loved the short gondola ride that took us there. The .50 cents fare was cheap and gave us the opportunity to go on a gondola ride. The Rialto Bridge and all the shops were right next to the market. The food at the Hotel was excellent, great selection and professional service. Breakfast was evidently designed for the american and european clientel. I strongly recommand the Hotel restaurant. The food is trully first class. We travel frequently and stay at five star hotels, Ca' Sagredo at the top of the list and we will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of facilities”
Reviews.Author: DDIKent
Reviews.Content: Not expecting gym/sauna or swimming pool but no bar!! (although couple of tables on canalside) no public seating areas in the lobby (a couple of chairs next to door) So after returning to the hotel in the evening you are unable to relax in the hotel bar and have a drink before bed and to chat to fellow guests. All 5star hotels previously stayed in have had ample lobby seating to have drink/coffee and again chat to fellow guests which I find helpful to exchange city tips. Also the restaurant is very small ,did not try the food however so cannot comment. did not see many diners using the restaurant either. the hotel was nice enough,staff pleasant ,location fine,everywhere is pretty much in walking distance in Venice I found. So not quite enough for me to warrant 5 stars Enjoyed the the trip and city immensely I would not stay at this hotel on my next visit purely for the above reasons

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not perfect and location is off”
Reviews.Author: Livingoutofasuitcase
Reviews.Content: Booking the 2 largest suites + 2 large deluxe rooms was not a pleasant process. 2 emails - no response. 1 phone call & then told they would get back to me. When they did and I accepted offer without negotiation I asked for a courtesy boat taxi to pick us up from the train station as we were 8. Answer was 'no, we dont do that, we offer flowers and a bottle of champagne'. I pointed out this was a large booking, their biggest suites, no reduction requested in rate, flowers & champagne are a standard in any suite and still got a 'no'. Finally the general manager cleared the minor expense of the boat taxi on a 'one time offer only'. Very mean & tight fisted and indeed shortsighted of this hotel. How do they hope to get returning guests like us? And they are brand new? Rooms were nice enough (no rooms in Venice are really, truly incredible - none I have found at least), bathrooms are brand new, public areas are a little like a convent and cold - lacking in splendour as far as decor goes. Entrance hall & lobby really are too boring & balnd. Breakfast is pleasant enough. Ballroom is stunning. Restaurant is tiny and very unimpressive looking. Biggest issue for em is the location. Although tshi hotel hopes to be the new 5 star luxury hotel of Venice it will not be able to compete on location with all the older 5 stars which are all much, much closer to San Marco. This hotel is closer to the train station & as such the area is not the grandest in Venice and high end shopping cannot be done in the area. PS: We had to pay for our own taxi boat back to the train station! PS: No flowers or champagne either!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not 5 star treatment”
Reviews.Author: Aldaris
Reviews.Content: We are just back from the Ca Segredo after a two night 10th anniversary trip. We enjoyed it very much and were full of the 'high' of being away as we are both busy working parents of three! We stayed in room 316 which is a Junior Suite at the side of the hotel. It was beautiful, very palatial but would need to be at about 650 euro a night. We had no complaints about the room-looking at a stucco ceiling every night, three tvs and a marble bathroom is wonderful. Our present from the hotel for our trip was chocolate dipped strawberries which we thought was a bit cheap. I agree a lot with the last reviewer's account. The breakfast is not 5 star standard. I have had much better breakfasts in 4 stars in Ireland. If you wanted a freshly bolied egg, you had to pay 7 euro!! We had dinner in the hotel restaurant one night. This was not a great experience. The 'restaurant' is a six table alcove with a heavy emphasis on fish. I ended up ordering breaded veal with chips and I didn't expect to see chips on a 5 star menu. Wouldn't eat there again. The hotel's location is perfect in the Canareggio region of the city which is much nicer than near the Rialto bridge. It felt more real than further up the canal. Venice is the most amazing city I have been to and I would recommend everyone to go. Its stunningly beautiful and not as expensive as you might expect but then I live in Ireland where the cost of living is quite high!!!!!!! Ca Segredo is lovely and we have great memories. Its not often you get to stay in a 15C palace. However, I didn't get a 5 star L experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zaria123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca Sagredo for 3 nights on a trip to Italy which started with 3 nights in Rome, 3 Nights Venice, and then one night in Florence. Venice is a truely beautiful place. When we told friends about it they kept saying about the smell, and dirty river etc. But honestly we found no smell (and the weather was hot in August when we were there), and the water was no more dirty than most places, no debris, just a sea green colour. We arrived at the Hotel by Water Taxi which cost 50 Euro, a lot for a trip which is about a mile or so, but worth it simply for the experience. We arrived at the Hotel and were greeted by the Concierge and escorted in to the large and beautiful reception hall. The Reception staff were very friendly and speak excellent English, check-in was simple and quick, and we were personally taken to our Suite by the Receptionist. We had booked a Junior Suite (Without River View), and it was really beautifully furnished, very spacious, with a neat little lounge area, three TV's, Internet Access (chargeable), Marble Bathrooom etc. The staff were also very friendly, and booked a couple of tours we wanted to go on - the Ghost Tour, and the Water Taxi Tour, they were also very helpful in recommending where to eat, although Italy generally isn't great for a lot of vegetarian variety , Pizza and Tomato Pasta get a little dull for 7 days, but we can't complain we still ate very well :-) We found the location excellent - and easy walking distance to St Marco and all the sights. The building lived up to all you would expect from a 15th Century Palace, with wall and ceiling Frescoes etc, all very palacial, and added to their immaculately clean everywhere. Breakfast was simple but nice, and had lots of fresh fruit, breads, yoghurts, cereals, scambled eggs, meats, and a great slection of 'Revolution Teas', I sell these in my Cafe in Belfast, and have never had them anywhere else before - Top Quality! Every night we had a trun down service, chocolates on our pillow, and little cotton towels placed on the carpet each side of the bed. Fluffy white dressing gowns, fluffy white slippers, lots of generously sized toiletries etc. We ate in the Hotel Restaurant one night, but were a bit limited by choice being vegetarians, also we confused the staff a bit (language barrier) and got three instead of four courses, but it was nice, and beautiful located outside right on the river. Pretty expensive for what we had, but we were there to enjoy ourselves, no count pennies!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money...2 star trying to be a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: DAALondon
Reviews.Content: Customer service equated to 0% the place lacks any soul and warmth and actually was exhausting to stay in, the breakfast was medocre for the rating and found all of the staff extremely unfriendly, our air con was not working requested 4 times for it to be looked at with no avail, was ignored when asking about the internet facility and was told the reason why our room was not cleaned at 4pm in the afternoon was that it was a weekend and priority was given to other arrivals! Tried to have dinner but was told we were not allowed to sit outside, the constant words we can't was ridiculous, breakfast was served in a room upstairs with the same classical CD playing day in day out, last day we were leaving early and wanted breakfast went down at 8am to find nothing had been prepared, this is a 2 star hotel asking 5 star prices a bowl of strawberries was 20euros! The lifts stank of food and the door man did not even ask if he could assist with baggage I have travelled and stayed in numerous luxury hotels but this was by far the worst, take my advice and dont waste your money Dina

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful palace, needs a little tune up”
Reviews.Author: sebastiaan4norfolk
Reviews.Content: A beautiful but sterile hotel that lacks a certain touch of warmth and friendliness. The place is a fairy tale Grand Canal palace with fresco and antiques and looks great with very spacious and well designed rooms. But up-tight service at the front desk and a frosty attitude ruins it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Place - Rude People”
Reviews.Author: isletraveler
Reviews.Content: Wow. Hard to write a negative review, but I feel that I must. It's really a combo of good and bad... Here is the good: The hotel itself is beautiful. The room we had was a multi-level suite and it was jaw droppingly pretty and roomy. The hotel is large and has been decorated well. We didn't eat at the restaurant but when we arrived we had a couple of cocktails out on the patio overlooking the water. The lady checking us in at the front desk was very courteous and hospitable, as well as the young man concierge, the staff at the restaurant/bar, and a man at the front desk upon checkout. The bad: This may seem tedious to some people, but it was enough to ruin any good feeling the hotel's first impression had on us. This was our first trip to Italy, and the second city we visited. We were a little unsure of the tipping etiquette, but had heard that you do not tip unless you are overly satisfied with any service you receive. The hotel employs a bellman who is in his mid/early 40's with dark hair, slightly balding. He brought up our bags and set them down, and stood around a second and then left. We were not sure if he expected a tip, but he had already gone so we didn't worry about it. We called to request extra pillows and he returned to show us where they were in the room. He stood around a bit longer, and seemed a bit flustered, so I felt that he did in fact expect a tip. I asked my husband to hand him the 10 euros he had, and we asked the bellman for 5 euros in return (we had 2 suitcases). He quickly and gruffly said he had no change, put the 10 euros in his pocket and hastily left the room. To be honest we were stunned...we just paid $17 for a bellman to bring up 2 pieces of luggage and show us pillows that were already in the room. We felt like we had been robbed. We tried to just use that as a learning experience, but it taints your experience nonetheless. We encountered a few more instances of 'rudeness' and overpricing by the gondola guys and the water taxis. It's amazing that such a beautiful, historical city has people like this, that don't mind being total jerks and/or try to rip you off with a straight face. I guess we are just too naive and nice when it comes to dealing with people and when visiting other countries. And who knows, maybe we just encountered all these people at once... What should have been a magical memory for a country that we would want to return to, became a place that we speak negatively of, and do not at all wish to return to. We visited a few other countries on our trip and had a fantastic time. We will go back to those places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tommy303030
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3nights and everything was absolutely perfect. We had a juniorsuite and the room was so nice. Breakfast was perfect to....and when we were there it was so quiet...we loved it. The hotel has a great location....easy the get to from palazzeroma with the vaparetto(10min) and at the stop(ca`dor) the hotel is 1min walk and the hotel is in a nice quiet area,walkingdistance to everything. We also took the vaparetto to the island lido to the beach,it was a great trip. Venice is a nice old city and 3nights was enough to see everything....but very expensive though.The restaurant at the hotel was magnificent...we had a 3course dinner and the food was stunning...right at the canal.We gonna go back for sure....thanks tommy

Reviews.Title: “Ca Sagredo”
Reviews.Author: Annl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Ca Sagredo and we cannot wait to return. My husband found the hotel when browsing the internet for somewhere in Venice for our 36th wedding anniversary. the website looked fantastic and I immediately checked out tripadvisor to see what others were saying. this confirmed his choice and we went ahead and booked. It is very easy to access from the vaparetto as the Ca D'or stop is just round the corner from the hotel, no steps to navigate with suitcases. on arrival we had been upgraded to a junior suite, with two windows, not a canal view but that did not matter a jot. from arrival to departure our stay was wonderful, the service was fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. We are sure that the staff were watching to see when we went out as everytime we came back the room had been tidied and new towels etc laid out Chocolate dipped strawberries were there on arrival and the breakfast buffett did include prosecco............ Needless to say there were several guests there either on honeymoon or anniversaries. would i recommend this hotel to others, absolutely as long as there is still room for me and my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Two_Als
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel! We have just retuned home from a long weekend trip to Venice. Hotel is situated in a great location to most major attractions but set in a quiet area on the Grand Canal. Hotel staff were extremely helpful. Hotel and rooms were absolutely stunning. I am quite a fussy traveller and have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world and would highly recommend this one to everyone! Couldnâ€™t find any faults! Great break!

Reviews.Title: “My own Palace!”
Reviews.Author: brazilian2005
Reviews.Content: After a week cruising in Croatia, we started our 5 days Venice "experience" in CaÂ´Sagredo Hotel. We loved every momento of our stay, including the fantastic room, with a Canal Grande view, the confort of the bed and all the amenities ( Prosecco, chocolate strawberrys, coupons for La Perla and Ferragamo), 3 TVs!!!! The wonderful staff was always there,including Roberta, Silvia and the boys..., everybody too kind. The housekeeper Claudia found my husband gold chain and leave a note for us, and the blonde girl in the breakfast ( sorry, forget her name) so friendly! In the hot days we spent in Venice, go back to CaÂ´Sagredo was like a gift!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Gem on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: AALynch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 3 night package at this beautiful palazzo comme hotel/museum through luxurylink as the finale to an 11 day tour through Italy in June. By the end of our stay, we were in love with Venice, and felt we could not have picked a better hotel. Our suite was absolutely beautiful and plush with a bedroom, 2 sitting rooms, and a marble bathroom. Aside from the beauty of the hotel, the staff was accomodating to a fault, and the included breakfast provided variety and was an enjoyable way to begin the day. Ca Sagredo is in a wonderful location right at the Ca d'Oro vaporetto stop and conviently located midway on the grand canal. I would not hesitate to return for the staff, the location, and sheer beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisima”
Reviews.Author: SpikeWilliams
Reviews.Content: I cant praise this place enough.This is a historic building and even if you aren't privelaged enough to stay in the triple height, fresco ceilinged, grand canal viewed rooms you can still enjoy the splendour of this ancient jewel during breakfast or even just while checking in, the whole building oozes history, art and romance. Expensive but a a real treat. Only 10mins from SanMarco and boat stop right outside. Defintely visit the market on the opposite side of the canal and the gorgeous low key italian eaterie called Vini da Gigio nearby, best italian I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMD
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing museum-hotel. From the moment we docked and walked directly into the foyer we were met with professioinalism and courtesy befitting the majesty of the surroundings. Silvia M. commanded the front desk, her smile, and the English language with grace. The tour of the hotel was offered by the concierge en route to our suite and was quite informative. I suggest taking an extra 10-15 minutes for this experience. Our room (304) was amazing. A sitting area with private patio to the interior, full bath/shower, and bedroom with windows opening directly onto the Grand Canal. I stress this point...directly over the Grand Canal.
